This group from the city of Carapeguá is called "Kuña Rory." It is now in its 12th loan cycle and has 15 members. They are women who strive to advance and pay for their daily household expenses. The goal of the women was to become part of the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women to have the benefit of the loans offered, with the goal of improving their business ventures and their quality of life.

Señora Gloria is one of the members who does her very best to be able to give her family a better future. She is a retailer. She has a convenience store in her home and invests her earnings in her business. She is very happy to be part of the Committees of Entrepreneurial Women program. She says that her business is very profitable since she notices the progress thanks to the benefit and opportunity to access loans through the Fundación Paraguaya.

She is applying for the loan to be able to buy foods, beverages, and other items, with which she will stock her business.

loans.use: to buy foods, beverages, and other items.

loans.name: Damas Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité "Damas Unidas"se originó a traves de promociones  que se isó en el barrio.Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio.El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La sra Alejandra, es Presidenta del grupo, ejerce la profesión de peluquera en su humilde hogar, en lo cual le va muy bien. Gracias a su negocio ha podido crecer y ser una buena comerciante.  Su deseo es habilitar una heladería a lado de su peluquería a fin de incrementar su ingreso, manifiesta que se siente muy a gusto en su comité y espera adquirir el múltiple beneficio que la Fundación le pueda ofrecer. Ella pondra el mayor de su esfuerzo para que su comité surja  y salga adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cremas, tintes, esmaltes, shampoo y demás insumos para poder surtir su peluquería.
texts.en:
The community bank "Damas Unidas" [United Women] started with promotions in the neighborhood. All the members are from the same area, acquaintances and neighbors in the neighborhood. The goal of each and every woman is to work, to promote their collective spirit, and to arrive at the maximum level of the program. 

Alejandra, the group's president, is a hair dresser and works in her modest home, which is going very well. Thanks to her business she has been able to grow and become a good shopkeeper. Her dream is to finance an ice cream parlor next to her beauty salon, with the goal of increasing her income. 

Alejandra declares that she's very at ease with her community bank and hopes to reap the many benefits offered by Fundación Paraguaya. She will put the majority of her energy to ensure that the group develops and gets ahead. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy creams, dyes, nail polish, shampoo and other goods to stock her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy goods to stock her beauty salon.

loans.name: Light Group

texts.en: This is 43 year old Ivy from Harare. She is married with two children, one attending school.  Ivy runs a manufacturing business producing drinks. The business has been in operation for 22 years. She says the main challenge faced is stiff competition. Ivy has requested a loan of $400 to buy raw materials to manufacture drinks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of the family. In the future, Ivy plans to supply big retail outlets.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to manufacture drinks

loans.name: Leoniteria

texts.en: Leoniteria is 60 years old, married and has three children. She is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. Leoniteria's main source of income comes from selling soap, canned goods, and boost food in her community. Leoniteria has been in this business for 8 years and earns 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Leoniteria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leoniteria is requesting a new loan of 4,500 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Association Des Relais Et Agents De Santé Communautaires (Arc) Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ARC est constitué de 2 agents de santé communautaires et de 3 relais polyvalents. Les agents de santé sont des bénévoles qui aident l'Infirmier chef de poste du village alors que les relais sont des volontaires qui interviennent dans la sensibilisation des populations sur certaines maladies.Ils se sont organisés pour mener des activités économiques pour se prendre en charge ainsi que leurs familles respectives.Ils font ainsi de l'embouche bovine et ovine. Le chef de groupe, en blanc, est un homme marié.Il est père de 5 enfants dont les 3 vont à l'école.Il mène des séances de sensibilisation auprès des populations pour venir à bout du paludisme et des diarrhées  qui sont les principales maladies qui sévissent dans le village. Aujourd'hui, le groupe sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter 20 moutons. L'ambition du groupe est de toujours agrandir leur activité.
texts.en:
Group ARC is constituted of two community healthcare agents and three polyvalent mediators. Healthcare agents are volunteers who assist the village head nurse, while mediators are volunteers who contribute to raising the population’s awareness about certain diseases.
They set up paying occupations for themselves, which allows them to support themselves and their respective families. They notably fatten beef and sheep. The group’s leader, wearing white, is a married man. He is a father of five; three of his children attend school. He leads awareness-raising sessions for the local population, in order to defeat malaria and diarrhea, the main diseases afflicting the village.
Today, the group is soliciting a loan for 500,000 FCFA with which they will purchase 20 sheep. The group’s ambition is to always develop their activity.

loans.use: buy twenty sheep.

loans.name: Marlon José

texts.es:
Marlon José actualmente es conductor,  un joven  con valores, deseos  de superación,   padre de  cuatro  hijos a  su cargo, los cuales quiere darles un futuro mejor con un techo digno y seguro.

Por esta razón,  se presentó a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para  compra de Cementó, Arena Y ladrillo, debido a que ha estado un poquito afectado con los fenómenos que han transcurrido en la zona, esto le permitirá obtener una mejor condición de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Currently Marlon José is a driver.  He is a young man with values who wants to improve himself, and the father of four children in his care whom he wants to give a better future with a decent and safe roof over their heads.

For this reason he went to CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy cement, sand, and bricks, because he has been a little affected by things that have happened in this region.  This will allow him to have better living conditions with his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité "Nueva Esperanza"se originó en la ciudad de San Ignacio, está integrado por 14 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa, con apoyo de la fundación paraguaya.
La sra Petrona, es Presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a vender productos de belleza, y en su tiempo libre se dedica a la repostería y vende por la zonas alrededores. Su deseo es seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia con los gastos del día a día de su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de productos de belleza, como ser labiales, polvos, maquillajes, bases y demás tipos, con los cuales podrá surtirse y cumplir con unos pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esparanza" (New Hope) communal bank began in the city of San Ignacio. It is made up of 14 women, all friends and neighbors in this city. The goal of each one of them is to work, develop a united spirit, and arrive at the highest level of the program, with the support of Fundación Paraguaya.

Señora Petrona is the president of the group. She sells beauty products, and in her free time she works at the confectionery and sells throughout the neighboring zones. Her desire is to continue working and in this way be able to continue helping her family with the day to day expenses.

She is applying for the loan to purchase beauty products such as lipstick, powders, makeup, bases, and other types, with which she will be able to stock up and fill the orders that she has.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en: This is 52-year-old Veronica from Harare. She is widowed with four children.Veronica runs a retail business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of capacity to satisfy the market. Veronica has requested a loan of $400 to buy clothes from South Africa. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of the family. In the future, Veronica plans to open a big shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Blessmore

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 22 year old Blessmore from Harare. She is married with one child.  Blessmore runs a health business selling surgical materials. The business has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of working capital. Blessmore has requested a loan of $1 500 to buy surgical materials. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of the family. In the future, Blessmore plans to supply surgical equipments to most parts of Zimbabwe.

loans.use: to buy surgical materials for resale

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  vit au Sénégal  et s’active dans le secteur du commerce plus particulièrement dans le domaine de la vente de boubous. Elle  est âgée  de 28 ans. Elle a choisi son activité par amour .Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de boubous destinés  à la vente.  Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus, de se prendre en charge et de mieux soutenir son mari dans la gestion des charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou lives in Senegal and is active in retail, more precisely in the domain of "boubou" (kaftan) sales. She is 28 years old. She picked this activity out of love.
She is a member of one of the U-IMCEC agencies, and has already repaid a previous loan. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 FCFA, earmarked for the purchase of boubous, which she will then resell. This financing will allow her to increase her sales, to provide for herself, and to better support her husband with the family’s expenses.

loans.use: buy "boubous" (Senegalese kaftans) for resale.

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 35 years old, is married, and has three children. Gena owns and operates a business running a "balot"*** food stall in the local community. Gena has been engaged in her business for 4 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Gena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gena is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

***fertilized duck (or chicken) egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Waax  Baax Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe "WAAX  BAAX " se compose de 5 femmes toutes mariées.Elles se sont constituées en groupe de solidarité et mène l'activité d'embouche bovine.Elles achètent des moutons qu'elle engraissent pendant  7 mois pour les revendre et se partager les bénéfices.Les revenus tirès de l'activité leur permettent ainsi de subvenir à leurs besoins et d'appui leurs maris dans la prise en charge de leurs familles respectives.Le chef du groupe, en jaune au milieu est mère de 5 enfants. Les 2 vont à l'école alors que les 3 autres pratiquent l'agriculture.
Le groupe sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter 25 moutons. Leur ambition est de s'engager plus tard dans l'embuche bovine.
texts.en:
Group "Waax Baax" is composed of 5 women, who are all married. They created their solidarity group and are in the business of ovine fattening. They purchase sheep, which they fatten for seven months, in order to resell them and share the profits. Profits from this business allow them to provide for themselves and to support their husbands in the care of their respective families.
The group leader, wearing yellow and in the middle, is a mother of five. Two of her children attend school, while three work in farming.
The group is requesting a loan of 500,000 FCFA with which to purchase 25 sheep. Their ambition is later to start in bovine fattening.

loans.use: purchase 25 sheep.

loans.name: Zair

texts.ru: Заир является потомственным пастухом, его отец и дед были пастухами в их селе в течении многих лет. Его семья - жена и дети, также помогают по уходу за козами и овцами. Его дети находятся в Российской Федерации на заработках. У каждого из них есть свой дом и семьи. В прошлом году ему пришлось покупать корм по высокой цене. Ему приходилось доплачивать пастуху дополнительно, что бы искать корм  с водой и скот отводить в более дальние регионы. Учитывая повышения цены к весне, он решил получить кредит на скот, планирует приобрести несколько голов коз. Муминджон очень рад, что существуют организации такие как Арванд, которые могут помочь ему в трудную минуту.
texts.en:
Zair is a hereditary shepherd. His father and grandfather were both shepherds in their village for many years. His family – wife and children also help him to take care of the goats and sheep. His children are now in the Russian Federation as workers. Every one of them has their own home and family.

In the past year Zair had to buy fodder at a higher price. He had to pay extra to the shepherd as well to go out and find fodder and water as well as take the cattle out to farther regions. Considering the higher prices in the spring he decided to get a loan for the cattle and plans to buy several goats. Zair is very happy that there are such organizations as Arvand which can help him during the hard times.

loans.use: to purchase several goats.

loans.name: Flor De Quinua Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE QUINUA” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Pascuala. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de calzados, tejido de chompas, venta de tostado, lavado de autos, artesanía en estuco, venta de tejidos, tejido de mantas.

La señora Pascuala,  indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una socia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en yeso (estuco) que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo, el mismo que aprendió de su yerno.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de compra de estuco) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las comunidades. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es separada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Flor de Quinua” (Quinoa Flower) is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Pascuala. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses in order to get ahead such as selling shoes, knitting sweaters, selling toasted foods, washing cars, making crafts from plaster, selling woven articles, and knitting blankets.

Sra. Pascuala says that she started working Pro Mujer one year ago and joined the organization upon receiving an invitation from a member. She currently has a business producing crafts out of plaster (stucco) where she has worked for some time. Pascuala learned this trade from her son-in-law.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for purchasing stucco that she acquires from the distribution shops. She will later sell the products she makes in her community. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Pascuala is separated from her spouse and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Pascuala said that she enjoys sharing with her fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy stucco for making crafts.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a married woman who has four children. She is 47 years old, and resides at Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Luzminda owns & operates a business venture, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community to earn her living. She has had 6 years experience in this business. Each month, she earns PHP6,000.00 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 10,000.00 to repair the borrower's fishing boat. This year, Luzminda joined GDMPC. In the future, Luzminda wants to build a house and to complete her children's studies.

loans.use: to repair a fishing boat.

loans.name: Felimon

texts.en:
Felimon is 54 years old and married. He has 4 children. He earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Felimon is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for his pigs.

Felimon has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling bread, operating a sari-sari store and also providing motorcycle transport. He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream, to save money and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Nissel

texts.en:
Nissel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. Nissel has a shop where she sells clothing like blouses, shirts & underwear. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for 7,000 to buy stock of clothing to sell.

Nissel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nissel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing for sell.

loans.name: Rosinda

texts.en:
Rosinda is 60 years old and married with nine children.

Rosinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Rosinda has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 12 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rosinda aspires to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old. Gloria is married and has two children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a fishing business, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Gloria has been in her business for four years and earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2008, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Teojerma

texts.en:
Teojerma, together with her husband, is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a broom-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more materials for her broom-making business.

Teojerma has been in this business for five years. Teojerma earns more income from making handicrafts, from a piggery and from a sari-sari (general) store.

Teojerma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her business.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
Doña Maria continua comercializando ropa, cosmeticos, y encargos que su clientela le hace, es atraves de sus ventas, pues es su medio de ganarse la vida, el cual lleva ya varios años,  con el financiamiento ha  venido a aumentar su mercaderia, lo que se ha favorecido con las ganancias para cumplir con sus compromiso de pago.
Con este nuevo prestamo, podra invertir en ropa de dama, ropa interior, cosmeticos, logrando mantener el equilibrio de sus ventas, asi mismo invertira un poco en la elaboracion de comida rapida, en tacos, enchiladas, hogdog, para vender los fines de semana en el cuadro de beisboll que se ha abierto la liga, y las ventas son buenas. Lo que se ayudara mas en su economia.
texts.en:
Doña Maria continues to sell clothing and cosmetics. She handles the orders received from her customers since this is how she makes her sales and earns her living. Maria has been in business for several years. With this loan, she will be able to increase her inventory of popular merchandise. Her earnings will allow her to complete her payment obligations.

Maria will use this new loan to invest in women’s clothing, undergarments, and cosmetics so that she can maintain stable sales. In addition, she will invest a small amount for preparing fast food such as tacos, enchiladas, and hot dogs to sell on the weekends at the baseball fields since the league season has started. Her sales should be good, which will be a great help to her finances.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics and to invest in fast food.

loans.name: Mbada Group

texts.en:
This is 28 year old Rutendo from Harare. She is married and has two children, both attending school. Rutendo runs a business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenges faced are too much competition, weather changes and an unstable economic environment. 

Rutendo has requested a loan of $400 to buy a variety of clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated, as a result of this loan, will allow her to assist in the upkeep of her family. In the future, Rutendo plans to own a bigger and much better clothing shop in the central business district.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jessiry

texts.en:
Jessiry is 47 years old and married. She has 3 children. Jessiry works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Jessiry has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF, prior to this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jessiry aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monicah, 37 years old, is from Nakuru and is single. She has a daughter who is 12 years old.

Monicah has a retail shop that she has been running for the past 18 years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD, to enable her to buy sugar and washing detergents to add to her stock for sale.

In the future, Monicah hopes to expand her business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar and washing detergent.

loans.name: Varsik

texts.en:
Varsik is 49 years old and she lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area. She is married and has two children: a daughter and a son. Varsik’s daughter is married and she lives separately from her parents; Varsik's son has just finished serving in the Armenian army. 

Varsik, her husband and their son are engaged in animal breeding and potato growing as well. Together, they rear cows, sheep and pigs. They sell produced dairy products and meat and thus support their family. 

Varsik intends to develop her farm. Therefore, she wants to buy bull-calves for her farm. She is seeking a $ 2.500 loan to buy some bull-calves and fodder as well.  

This is Varsik’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy some bull-calves and fodder as well.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Arlyn has a shop where she sells clothing like shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 to buy stocks of clothing like shirts, blouses & underwear to sell.

Arlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Arlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing like shirts, blouses & underwear to sell.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 31 years old. Jennelyn is married and has three children. To make a living, Jennelyn buys and sells eggs in the local community. Jennelyn has been in this business for three years and gets 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2010, Jennelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennelyn is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional eggs to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional eggs to sell.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ma. Flor

texts.en:
Ma. Flor is 40 years old and married. She has 4 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Flor is borrowing PHP 10,000, through NWTF, to buy feed and additional piglets.

Ma. Flor has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from her sari-sari store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so that she can send her 3 children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 58 years old and married. She has 6 children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Corazon is borrowing PHP 12,000, through NWTF, to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Corazon has been farming rice for 2 years and also earns additional income from her sari-sari store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Amancia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Amancia works hard to support her family. She has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Amancia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her business.

Amancia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman who has 2 children. Jocelyn is 49 years old, residing at Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. 

Jocelyn owns & operates a business venture, raising fish for sale to earn a living. She's had 7 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP8,000.00 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 20,000.00 to purchase additional fish to raise. In 2011, Jocelyn became a member of GDMPC. In the future, Jocelyn wants to build a house and to help her children complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise.

loans.name: Gwena

texts.en:
Gwena is 60 years old and married. She has 2 children. Gwena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan, through NWTF, to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Gwena has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming vegetable.

Gwena aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en: Erlina is married and has 4 children. She is 33-years-old and lives in the Philippines. Erlina is a farmer and she operates a gardening venture to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. Every month she earn 4,000.00 from this work. She has requested a loan of 10,000.00 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This year, Erlina been a member of GDMPC. In the future, Erlina  hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Marina Enriqueta

texts.es:
Marina Enriqueta es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como profesora de primaria en una escuela de una comarca muy cercana a dicho municipio donde tiene mucha experiencia en la docencia y de enseñarles a leer y escribir a niños siendo este trabajo lo que la apasiona y permite que lleve el pan de cada día a su hogar.

Es madre soltera con una hija que ha sacado adelante sola con el esfuerzo propio y que ha educado de la mejor manera posible y como madre responsable quiere darle la mejor preparación profesionalmente para que sea una persona de bien, trabajadora y que se defienda en el futuro. 

Por tal razón, el crédito que ahora está solicitando es para la compra de pintura y una puerta para seguir mejorando su vivienda, ya que como parte de brindarle este bienestar a su querida hija está en tener un hogar con todas las condiciones adecuadas y que ceprodel siempre le ha brindado su apoyo desde que trabaja con créditos.
Por lo que espera con seguridad siempre el apoyo que ha recibido en créditos anteriores y no quedarles mal en el futuro.
texts.en:
Marina Enriqueta is originally from the town of El Sauce. She currently works as an elementary school teacher at a regional school near her town. Marina has plenty of experience teaching children how to read and write. She is passionate about her work, which has allowed her to earn a daily living.

Marina is a single mother with a daughter. She has pressed forward through her own efforts and provided her child with an education in the best way possible. Like any responsible mother, she wants to give her child the best preparation for becoming a professional and a person who is successful, hardworking, and able to provide for the future.

For this reason, Marina is requesting a loan now in order to buy paint and a door so that she can continue improving her home. Part of providing for her daughter involves having a home with adequate conditions. Ever since Marina started working with loans, CEPRODEL has always been supportive of her. With confidence, she always expects to have this support just as she did with her previous loans so that nothing will go wrong in the future.

loans.use: to buy paint and a door.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras, que se esfuerzan por ayudarse.
La Sra. Sonia se dedica a la costura y cuenta que lleva mucho tiempo  en ese trabajo y eso la ha ayudado a formarse una buena clientela. Ella realiza todo tipo de prendas, de muy buena calidad, y es por ello que sus clientes siempre acuden hasta ella.
Sonia solicita el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos, con los cuales podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que ha recibido.
texts.en:
This committee is from the city of San Lorenzo. The members of this established committee have set forth as their main goal to be having each individual experience growth, not only financially, but on a personal level as well. These members are known in their area as extremely hardworking women who strive to help one another.

Sra. Sonia is a seamstress and has been in this line of work for a long time. This has helped her to establish a good customer base. She produces all types of garments that are of very good quality. For this reason, her customers always request her work. Sonia is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics and thread so that she can complete her customers' orders. She is very grateful for the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Abdulsalam

texts.en:
Abdulsalam is 28 years old, married and a father of only one son. He lives in Ibb, Yemen and his qualification is diploma only. 

Previously, he was a worker in a telecommunication shop, introducing phone services and selling mobile recharge cards to his customers. He has been involved in this kind of business since 2002.  After collecting enough money, he purchased this business from the owner and became in need of funds to purchase more goods for the shop to meet the demands of his clients. He would like to ask for financial assistance because his household expenses are continually increasing due to the needs of his growing son. He is facing a financial shortage. Therefore, he was encouraged to borrow additional capital.

Abdulsalam took a loan of 100,000 YER from Alamal Bank, which he will use to purchase mobile recharge cards to sell to his customer and to develop services for his telecommunications shop. 

In the future, he hopes to be a high merchant in order to buy a phone accessories store and to earn an increased income, which will enable him to pay his obligation in school and some of his household expenditures.

loans.use: to purchase mobile recharge cards to sell

loans.name: Cherlie

texts.en:
Cherlie is 60 years old and married with two children.

Cherlie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of goods to sell in her store.

Cherlie has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 30 years and earns additional income from selling charcoal.

Cherlie aspires to save enough money so she can provide a secure future for her family and do some house improvements.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Phebe

texts.en: Phebe is a 29-year-old, single woman from Tabuan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. Phebe's main source of income comes from selling a variety of home use products in her community. Phebe has been in her business for five years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Phebe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Phebe is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

loans.name: Jesan Jan

texts.en:
Jesan Jan is 24 years old and married with a 7-month-old baby. He has been a seaweed farmer for a year now. Jesan Jan has his business in the island of Hingotanan, Bien Unido, Bohol. Jesan Jan also runs a sari-sari store business. He sells items like canned goods, detergent soap, snack foods and toiletries. Jesan Jan works hard to provide for his family.

Jesan Jan is requesting a loan to purchase seaweed farming materials such as seedlings, wooden pegs and strings. In the future, Jesan Jan hopes to expand his seaweed farming business.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed farming materials

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is 55 years old and married. She has five children living with her in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. Nilda is engaged in raising pigs to make a living. She's been four years in this business and every month she earns PHP 10,000 from her business undertakings. In 2011, Nilda joined GDMPC. She has requested 30,000 PHP from the cooperative to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. When all of these animals are grown, Nilda hopes to sell them at a higher price to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sodnompil

texts.en:
Sodnompil is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in Tosontsengel soum in the Zavhan province. His wife has just given a birth to a child and so far is staying at home and taking care of the three children. He has been running a garment retailing business for three years. He brings the supplies back from Erlian city, China. He stopped the business for a while due to his new child's birth. His shop counter is located in the big market in the village. Therefore, he has many regular customers who appreciate the goods he sells. Now, he is planning to continue his business by getting the supplies in large quantities. He is an active, hardworking guy who says, "I would like to continue and expand my business to improve my family's livelihood and save for my three children's future". The total amount he is requesting is 500,000 MNT for the supplies.
"

loans.use: To purchase more garments to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is a married woman who has two children. Rosemarie is 25 years old and resides in Upper Bayao, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Rosemarie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She been in the business for two years.  Each month, she earns 1,500 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 2,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2010, Rosemarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Rosemarie wants to build a house and have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 43 years old, married, and has five children. Fe owns and operates a business raising fish to sell. She has been in her business for seven years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a new loan of 6,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise

loans.name: Roche Mhar

texts.en:
Roche Mhar is 23 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Roche Mhar runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Roche Mhar has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, egg, spices, etc.

In the future, Roche Mhar would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Jenny Ann

texts.en:
Jenny Ann is 33 years old and married with three children.

Jenny Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Jenny Ann has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 16 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Jenny Ann aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Lenny

texts.en:
Lenny is 39 years old and married with two children.

Lenny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Lenny has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lenny aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Maribeth has been in this business for 35 years. Maribeth earns more income from raising pigs.

Maribeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to build and expand her fish cage in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old. Nelly is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Nelly  is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Nelly has been in her business for three years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Nelly is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Earlier this year, Nelly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Marilou is a widow and has five children. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a business venture, making and selling snack foods in the local community. Marilou has been in her business for eight years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional snacks to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional snacks to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is a married woman who has three children. Nida is 42 years old, residing at Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Nida owns and operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living, and she's been in this business 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to repair her fishing boat. Nida has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Nida wants to build a house and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a married woman with one child. Juliet is 21 years old and resides in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Juliet owns & operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living and she's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,500 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to repair her fishing boat. In 2008, Juliet became a member of GDMPC. In the future, Juliet wants to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 58 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Carmen runs an ambulant business vending plastic wares in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of plastic ware.

Carmen has been in this business for 41 years.

In the future, Carmen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic ware

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Abdoulaye est un agriculteur qui pratique aussi l'élevage.Il est marié et père de trois enfants.Ses activités lui permettent de subvenir à ses propres besoins et à ceux de sa famille.Afin de renforcer son activité, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter 3 boeufs. Son ambition et d'élargir sa capacité.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is a farmer who also breeds livestock. He is married and the father of 3 children. His business activities enable him to meet his own needs as well as those of his family.

In order to strengthen his business, Abdoulaye is requesting a 400 000 francs to buy 3 oxen. His ambition is to expand his capacity.

loans.use: to buy 3 oxen.

loans.name: Djiby

texts.fr: Monsieur Djiby est un vieux de 62 ans qui évolue dans le secteur  de l’agriculture. Il gère un champ et  c’est une activité qu’il a choisi par nécessité. Il a déjà remboursé 2 prêts  antérieurs  au sein du guichet de l’U-IMCEC ou il est sociétaire.  Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour  l’achat de nouvelles semences  pour son champ. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses rendements, d’augmenter ses revenus pour mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en: Djiby is 62 years old and involved in agriculture.  He manages a field, an activity he has chosen out of necessity.  He has already repaid 2 previous loans to the UIMCEC branch where he is a member.  He is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs.  With this loan he is planning to buy additional seeds for his field.  This loan will allow him to increase his productivity and income, so that Djiby can better provide for himself.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Ngor

texts.fr: Ngor est un homme marié , père de cinq enfants. Il pratique depuis plusieurs années l'élevage et l'agriculture. Il achète des bœufs dans les marchés hebdomadaires, les engraisse pendant 8 mois puis les revend. Cette activité lui permet d'obtenir des revenus assez consistants pour entretenir sa famille. Afin de faire une nouvelle opération d'embauche, il sollicite un prêt de 400000 f pour acheter 3 bœufs et de l'aliment bétail. Son ambition est de toujours continuer à renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Ngor is married and father to 5 children. He has been farming and breeding livestock for several years. He buys oxen at the weekly markets, fattens them up during 8 months, and then resells them. This business allows him to earn fairly a consistent income with which to take care of his family.

In order to begin a new buying exercise, Ngor is requesting a loan of 400 000 francs with which to buy 3 oxen and some cattle feed. His aim is to keep strengthening his business.

loans.use: to buy 3 oxen and some cattle feed.

loans.name: Kuña Ñembyaty Mba´apora Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Ñembyaty Mba´apora´´, esta situado en la ciudad de Villa Ygatimi en una Colonia en una comunidad indígena. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, con doce integrantes en la cual todas son mujeres indígenas, han demostrado unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras y son muy trabajadoras hoy ya hacen parte del Comité de la Fundación Paraguaya.
Alfonza es una de las miembros  y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la cría de varios animales de corral, como ser chanchos, gallinas, patos, etc. Es gracias a este trabajo que ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles el pan de cada día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y creciendo. Su meta es poder tener una granja grande y tener muchos animales.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Ñembyaty Mba'apora" is located in the city of Villa Ygatimi in a residential area of an indigenous community.  The group is currently in its first loan cycle and is comprised of 12 members who are all indigenous women.  They have shown union and support among themselves and are very hard workers.  They belong to the Fundación Paraguaya Committee.

Alfonza, one of the members,  raises small animals such as pigs, chickens, ducks, etc.  Thanks to her work she has been able to support her family and put food on the table every day.

She is requesting a loan to buy animal feed so she can continue to work and grow her business.  Her goal is to have a larger farm with many animals.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La Sra. Soledad tiene 34 años,  está casada con el Sr. Eliseo de 39 años, tienen 3 hijos, uno de 11 que está cursando sus estudios primarios, otra de 5años  que también está iniciando sus estudios primarios  y otro 1 año.
La Sra. Soledad se dedica a la contabilidad, lleva el estado contable de algunas empresas, pero comenta que aunque trabaje mucho hay veces que el dinero no es sufriente, es por ello que ella y su esposo siempre se esfuerzan al máximo para poder dar a sus hijos lo que necesitan para una vida mejor.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de una computadora, la cual le facilitará mucho el trabajo que hace, pues lo estaba haciendo en una computadora muy vieja y que le hacia muy difícil trabajar y de esa forma le es muy difícil. Agradece por esta oportunidad de progreso que está recibiendo
texts.en:
Mrs. Soledad is 34 years old, married to Mr. Eliseo, 39, and they have three children, an 11-year-old who is in grade school, a 5-year-old just beginning grade school and a one-year-old.

Soledad is an accountant who provides service to several companies.  She says that even though she works hard, many times there is not enough money so she and her husband are always doing their best to give their children what they need to lead a better lifestyle.

She is requesting a loan to buy a computer to make her work easier, since now she works on an old computer which makes her job harder.  She is grateful for this opportunity to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Mame Gueye

texts.fr: Madame Mame  Gueye est âgée  de 43 ans et habite au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le commerce et la vente de tissus et d’accessoires pour femmes. Elle a  déjà remboursé 3 prêts  antérieurs. Elle a choisi son activité par nécessité. Elle est membre d’un  des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  et a déjà remboursé 3 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un prêt de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de nouvelles marchandises dans le but de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Ce financement pourra  l’aider a  accroitre ses bénéfices, a  se prendre en charge et aussi a soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mame Gueye is 43 years old and lives in Senegal. She sells fabrics and accessories for women. She chose her business out of necessity.

Mame Gueye is a member of a UIMCEC branch and has already repaid 3 previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs in order to buy new merchandise so that she can meet her customer demand. This loan could help her to increase her profits, take care of herself and support her husband with meeting the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and accessories for resale.

loans.name: Justimiano

texts.es:
La Sr  Justimiano  está  casado,  tiene una pequeña despensa ,  la venta del  mismo es gratificante ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad de clientes y el ingreso es bastante satisfactorio.
Con la ayuda de su esposa e hijas están  saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación. Hoy día se ha convertido en una microempresario exitoso y en constante progreso. Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que debemos brindarle todo el apoyo necesario.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, lácteos y demás artículos de primera necesidad, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y a la vez ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Justimiano is married and has a small store where he enjoys attending to his many customers.  The income he makes is quite satisfactory.

With the help of his wife and daughters, he is able to get ahead with hard work and dedication.  He has become a successful micro-entrepreneur with constant growth.  He has proven himself to be responsible and honest with his commitments and this is why we must give him the necessary support.

He is requesting a loan to buy beverages, groceries, dairy products and other essential items to restock his store and offer a wider variety of products to customers.

loans.use: To buy essential goods.

loans.name: Janete

texts.es:
La Sra. Janete es Brasilera, pero vive en Paraguay hace mas de 20 años, es madre de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y una menor. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos  y también a la venta de joyas de plata hace varios años, cuenta con clientela formada, ya es reconocida por su actividad y su carisma para la venta de sus productos. 
Ella comenta que por medio de este trabajo dio a su hijo la educación que ellos necesitaban, y gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio ahora ya son profesionales. Desea poder seguir trabajando y creciendo como comerciante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos y joyas, ya que tiene varios pedidos y quiere poder cumplir con estos. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le están dando para progresar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Janete is Brazilian but has lived in Paraguay for over 20 years.  She is the mother of three children, two adults and one minor.  For several years she has been selling cosmetics and silver jewelry and has a fixed customer base.  She is well-known in her business and for her charisma in selling her products.

She tells us that through her work she has been able to give her children the education they needed, and thanks to her efforts and sacrifice they are professionals.  She wants to continue working and growing as a merchant.

The loan she is requesting is to buy cosmetics and jewelry since she has many orders to fill.  She is grateful to the foundation and Kiva for this opportunity to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Ilse

texts.es:
La Sra. Ilse es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es soltera, y tiene dos hijos menores que van a la escuela. Ella tiene una despensa - mercería en su domicilio, ya hace 4 años que logro abrir su negocio.
Anteriormente trabajaba en un comercial y logró juntar un poco de dinero y después se propuso y abrió su propio negocio. Su meta es seguir creciendo y de esa forma ayudar a su familia. Solicita dicho crédito para la compras de útiles escolares ya que se inicia el año escolar y desea poder tener bien abastecida su mercería. Sueña con abrir un distribuidora y dar trabajo a las personas de su comunidades
texts.en:
Mrs. Ilse is from the city of San Lorenzo.  She is single and has two minor children who go to school.  She runs a general that store she opened in her home four years ago.  

Previously, she worked in a shopping center and was able to save enough money to open her own business.  Her goal is to keep growing and support her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy school supplies for the upcoming school season, with the idea of having her store well-stocked.  She would like to become a distributor and offer employment to people in her community.

loans.use: To buy school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Rokhiyatou

texts.fr: Rokhiyatou est une femme mariée mariée sans enfant. Elle a arrêté ses études au collège et,après une formation d e5 ans,elle a ouvert un atelier de couture chez elle. Aujourd'hui, elle dispose de 5 machine à coudre et arrive à générer des revenus qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge et de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un prêt de 400000f pour acheter une machine à coudre et des accessoires. Son ambition est de renforcer ses équipements.
texts.en: Rokhiyatou is a married woman with no children. She left school at secondary level, and after training for five years opened a dressmaking workshop at home. Today she has five sewing machines and manages to generate sufficient income to take care of herself and provide for her family's needs. She is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to boost her business by buying a sewing machine and accessories. Her ambition is to reinforce her equipment.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and accessories

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El señor Marcos es de la ciudad de Itá, tiene 34 años de edad, se dedica a la construcción hace mas de 10 años, y comenta que tiene muy buena madera para esto, ya que siempre tiene muy buen trabajo para hacer y es solicitado para muchas obras.
El señor Marcos es una persona muy sacrificada y profesional en su trabajo, siempre trata de dar lo mejor en su actividad y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad para compartir con todos su vida profesional. Su meta es seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para el día a día.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas, lo que le permitirá hacer un mejor trabajo y servir mejor. Agradece la oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Marcos is from the city of Itá.  He is 34 years old and he has been working in the building trade for more than 10 years.  He says that he is very skilled at this kind of work.  He always does very good work and is requested for a lot of jobs.

Marcos is a very selfless person and professional in his work.  He always tries to give his best at work and is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for this opportunity to share his professional life with everybody.  His goal is to continue working so that he can help his family and provide them with what they need.

Marcos is requesting a loan to buy tools which will allow him to do a better job and serve people better.  He is grateful for the opportunity that he is being given as it will be very helpful to him.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Ousmane est un homme marié, père de 3 enfants, tous élèves. Il est un ancien footballeur qui a fait les beaux jours du club de sa ville. Parallèlement au sport, il été embauché dans une boulangerie qu'il finira par acheter avec l'appui de sa famille. Aujourd'hui, il emploie près de 5 personnes dont deux de ses frères.Il a ouvert également, il y'a 3 mois, une alimentation qu'il gère lui même.Cette diversité de ses activités lui permet d'obtenir des revenus assez substantiels pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des sacs de farine et des produits alimentaires. Son ambition est de renforcer ses activités.
texts.en: Ousmane is a married man who is father to three grown-up children. He is a former footbballer who spent his heyday playing for the club in his town. At the same time as doing his sport he was employed by a bakery, and he ended up buying this with help from his family. Today he employs five people, including two of his brothers. He also opened a grocery store three months ago and he runs this himself. The diversity of his businesses allows him to make quite substantial income so that he can provide for his needs and those of his family. In order to strengthen his business, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs so that he can buy sacks of flour and groceries. His ambition is to build up his businesses.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour and groceries

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La Señora Anastacia es de la ciudad de Itá, tiene 52 años, está casada con el Señor Marcos de profesión albañil, con quien tiene varios hijos de los cuales dos se encuentran viviendo aun con ella. Ambos se encuentran trabajando y ayudando a sus respectivas  madres.
Anastacia tiene una pequeña despensa, donde surte a sus vecinos y clientes ocasionales, brindando mejores precios, calidad y variedad de sus productos. Es una señora muy trabajadora y humilde que se encuentra trabajando hace varios años con la Fundación paraguaya y está muy agradecida por la confianza otorgada.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, azúcar, arroz, fideos, lácteos y demás insumos necesarios para abastecer su negocio, y con lo cual seguirá trabajando.
texts.en:
Anastacia is from the city of Itá.  She is 52 years old and married to Marcos who is a builder.  The couple have several children, two of whom are still living with them.  They both work and help their mother.  

Anastacia has a small grocery store where she supplies her neighbors and casual customers, providing them with the best prices, quality and variety of products.  She is a very hard-working and unassuming lady who has been working with Fundación Paraguaya for several years.  She is very grateful for the trust they have placed in her.

Anastacia is requesting this loan to buy drinks, sugar, rice, noodles, dairy products and other supplies she needs to stock her business.  This will allow her to keep working.

loans.use: to buy basic household products to sell

loans.name: Abdou Salam

texts.fr: Abdou est un  homme marié , père de 7 enfants. Il pratique la construction mais aussi le montage de projet .Avec les marchés de bâtiments qu'il gagne , il parvient à obtenir des revenus qui lui permettent d'entretenir sa famille. Afin de compléter son capital pour l'ouverture d'une station service de nettoyage de véhicule, il sollicite un pret de 5000000f. Son ambition est de s'engager dans l'immobilier.
texts.en: Abdou is a married man who is father to seven children. He is a builder but also puts together projects. With the profits he makes from buildings he manages to make sufficient income to look after his family. In order to top up his capital for the opening of a car cleaning service station, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs. His ambition is to involve himself in the real estate market.

loans.use: to open a car cleaning service station

loans.name: Mairoby Odalia

texts.es:
Mairoby Odalia tiene 43  años es soltera, vive con los hijos. Vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

La Ventanilla EL SAGRADO CORAZON, esta ventanilla se encuentra ubicada en el sector de las calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica al Comercio.

Mairoby Odaliza se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa de niños y adultos, además de sabanas y artículos de belleza para mujeres.El dinero es para la comprar de ropa y articulos de belleza.

Las compras de los insumos las realiza en la ciudad de Guayaquil en la Bahía. El crédito les ayudado a aumentar la producción y tener productos de calidad, el sueño de Mairoby  es tener dinero para seguir invirtiendo, ha enfrentado desafíos como los precios altos y la competencia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta dedicarse al hogar.
texts.en:
Mairoby Odalia is 43 years old and single.  She lives with her children en El Cantón Ventanas in the Province of Los Ríos.

Her communal banking group is called El Sagrado Corazon.  This group is located at the cross streets of Ernesto Briones and Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, which is in the town of Cantón Ventanas.  This group is dedicated to commerce.

Mairoby Odalia is dedicated to the business of selling clothes for children and adults, as well as sheets and beauty products for women.  The money is to buy clothing and beauty products.

She does her grocery shopping in the city of Guayaquil in the Bay.  The credit has helped her group increase their production and the quality of their products.  Mairoby's dream is to have money in order to continue investing.  She has faced challenges like high prices and competition.  

In her free time she likes to work around the house.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and beauty products.

loans.name: Ojo De Agua Group

texts.es:
Janitzio tiene 25 años de edad es parte del grupo “Ojo de Agua” comenta que sus compañeros le pusieron ese nombre porque muy cerca de donde se reúnen hay un nacimiento de agua y le dicen así. El se dedica a la venta de fruta de temporada platica que parte de la fruta que vende el la cultiva y la otra parte el la compra en la central de abastos de una población cercana a la de él, dice que tiene con su negocio desde hace 10 años que desde muy jovencito él le ayudaba a sus padres a vender en los tianguis y en las calles de varias localidades. Janitzio está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de fruta como durazno, aguacate, zarzamora, coliflor, lechuga, espinacas, zanahorias etc. También dice que comprara abono y fertilizantes ya que tiene una huerta de aguacate y tiene aproximadamente 50 árboles de los cuales nada mas 30 dan producción de ese fruto. Una de sus dificultades que se le dificulta transportar sus frutos por que le cobran mucho de flete, a él le gustaría tener un vehículo propio por eso le está echando ganas a su trabajo para poder comprar una camioneta de uso y para seguir sembrando mas plantas de aguacate ya que es un buen negocio, también le encantaría tener vacas, puercos y borregos para tener el futuro de sus hijos asegurado. El está casado con la señora Carolina la cual es ama de casa y tienen 2 niños el mayor de 9 años y el menor de un año ocho meses.
Los otros cinco integrantes del grupo se llaman Maribel, Adela, Felisa, Maria Ysabel, Miguel, ellos invertirán sus créditos en la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo para su venta y para la compra y venta de frutas y legumbres de temporada.
texts.en:
Janitzio is 25 years old and a member of the 'Ojo de Agua' group.  He says that his fellow members gave the group this name because there is a water source very near where they meet with this name.  

Janitzio's business is selling seasonal fruit.  He says that he grows some of the fruit he sells himself and buys the rest in the wholesale food market in a nearby town.  He says that he has been in this business for ten years, since he was very young.  He used to help his parents sell in the markets and streets in different towns.  Janitzio is requesting a loan to buy fruit such as peaches, avocados, blackberries, cauliflowers, lettuce, spinach, carrots, etc.  He says that he will also buy manure and fertilizers because he has an avocado orchard with approximately 50 trees but only 30 are producing.  One of the difficulties that he has is transporting his fruit because it costs a lot to pay somebody to do this.  He would like to have his own vehicle and he is working hard so that he can buy a used truck.  He would also like to continue sowing more avocado plants because this is a good business, and he would love to own cows, pigs and lambs so that he can guarantee his children's future.

Janitzio is married to Carolina who is a homemaker.  They have two children who are 9 years old and 20 months old.  The other five members of this group are Maribel, Adela, Felisa, Maria Ysabel and Miguel.  They will invest their loans in buying catalog beauty products and seasonal fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Flores De Rio Group

texts.es:
Ausencia cuenta con 60 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos los cuales están estudiando Adilene esta en 2° de cbta, Neli esta en 4° de primaria y Bryam esta en 1° de preescolar, su esposo se llama sirenio es albañil, ella se dedica al comercio vende refrescos y dulces lo cual dice que le va muy bien con el negocio e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de refrescos de varios sabores y de dulces doña ausencia dice que le gustaría incrementar mas el negocio pero que lo hará poco a poco con calma espera sacarlo adelante como hasta ahora ya que el préstamo fue de gran utilidad.

Ausencia  pertenece al grupo flores de rió el cual esta integrado por 12 miembros dos hombres y diez mujeres las cuales todas trabajan a continuación serán mencionados: Virginia, Flor del Carmen, Celerina, Freddy, Nicolasa, Demecia, Igudina, Santos, Estela, Maria Elvia, Jennifer, todos realizan una actividad comercial como son: tamales, refrescos, pan, jugos, dulces, pizzas, perfumes, cosméticos,  carnicería, etc.
texts.en:
Ausencia is 60 years old, married, and has four children.  Adilene is in her second year of CBTA (an upper-middle level agricultural education institution), Neli is in her fourth year of elementary school and Bryam is in the first year of pre-school.  Her husband is called Sirenio and he is a builder.  Ausencia's business is selling soft drinks and sweet treats.  She says that her business is doing very well and she will invest her loan in buying different flavors of soft drink and sweet treats.  Ausencia says that she would like to further expand her business but she will do it gradually and calmly.  She hopes to continue making progress as she has up to now as her previous loan was very useful.

Ausencia belongs to the 'Flores de Rio' group which has twelve members: two men and ten women.  They all work and their names are Virginia, Flor del Carmen, Celerina, Freddy, Nicolasa, Demecia, Igudina, Santos, Estela, Maria Elvia and Jennifer.  They all have their own business activity such as: selling tamales, soft drinks, bread, juice, sweet treats, pizzas, perfume, cosmetics, meat, etc.

loans.use: to buy different flavored drinks and sweet treats

loans.name: Mande 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme ABIBATA est la représentante du groupe MANDE 2. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus  âgée 15ans et le moins âgée a 07ans. Tous  vont  à l’école et elle a 03 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des légumes depuis 02ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de  pissy .Ses clients sont les  hommes et femmes.

Mme veut  s’acheter  01 sac de gombo sec ; 50kg de choux et 50kg d’aubergine.

Elle épargne ses bénéfices pour  agrandir son hangard. Mme ambitionne  ouvrir une boutique de stockage pour les légumes et scolarisé ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abibata is the representative of the Mande 2 Group. She is married and the mother of three children. The eldest is 15 years old and the youngest is 7. All of them attend school and she has three people in her care.

Mrs. Abibata has been selling vegetables for two years. She gets her supplies at the market in Pissy. Her customers are men and women.

Mrs. Abibata wants to purchase herself one sack of dried okra, 50kg of cabbage and 50kg of eggplant.

She is saving her profits in order to expand her covered stall. Mrs. Abibata aims to open a vegetable warehouse and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase herself one sack of dried okra, 50kg of cabbage and 50kg of eggplant.

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr: Monsieur Malick habite dans lune des banlieues sénégalaises. Il s’active dans le secteur de l’élevage de moutons. C’est une activité qu’il a choisi par nécessité dans le but d’augmenter ses revenus. L est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa zone d’habitation et a déjà remboursé 2 crédits antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de quelques petits moutons a élever et qui seront destinés a la vente. Son souhait est  renforcer le nombre de bétail qu’il possède pour éventuellement accroitre ses revenus et améliorer son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Malick lives in a Senegalese suburb. He raises sheep. He chose this line of work out of necessity, with the aim of augmenting his income.

Malick is a member of his local UIMCEC branch and has already repaid 2 previous loans. He is requesting a loan of 100 000 francs, with which to buy some young sheep to raise and then resell. He wishes to boost the number of livestock he owns so that he can eventually increase his income and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy ewes to raise and later resell.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia   Haydee sigue pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II” y continua viviendo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde también realiza sus actividades económicas. 

La socia Haydee ya no se dedica a  la venta de comida pues le fue muy mal pero ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora sigue adelante pues ahora se dedica a la venta de helados de forma ambulatoria.  En esta oportunidad Haydee requiere el préstamo para compra mas helados.  

La socia Haydee agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: The associate Haydee belongs to the communal bank “IMASUMAC II” and still lives in the city of Cusco where she also conducts her economic activities. Haydee is no longer engaged in the selling of food because it went very poorly.  However, she is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who continues moving forward.  Now she sells ice cream out of a cart. At this time Haydee needs a loan to buy more ice cream. The associate Haydee gives thanks for the support that has been given and at the same time she is committed to comply in a disciplined manner with the loan repayments.

loans.use: to purchase more ice creams

loans.name: La Estacion Group

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es uno de los miembros de un grupo llamado la estacion el cual esta integrado por nueve personas muy unidas, trabajadoras y amable, cada una de estas personas tiene una actividad economica la cual desempeña para sacar adelante a sus familias y asi poder darles una mejor calidad de vida. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una comunidad la cual se caracteriza por estar en una zona cañera.




la señora victoria tiene la edad de 27 años, solo estudio la primaria y es madre soltera de dos hijos el mayor de nombre Rodolfo que tiene 7 años de edad y estudia la primaria y una niña de Alexandra de 6 años que asiste al preescolar. Ella nos platica que siempre a tenido que trabajar para sacar a su familia adelante pero que hace un poco mas de 8 meses abrio una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en un local que tiene en la parte de enfrente a su casa en el cual vende todos los dias de ocho de la mañana a ocho de la noche, apesar de que su negocio es nuevo en su colonia ya tiene muchos clientes los cuales le hacen el gasto, ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de leche,huevos, detergentes, refrescos, dulces, aceite, frijol, papel higienico,servilletas, galletas, sopa, cafe y azucar para resurtir su negocio, ella espera que ya que su negocio este mas surtido atraiga mas clientes para poder aumentar sus venta y ganancias y continuar invirtiendo en el negocio y dar a sus hijos mejor calidad de vida. ella dijo"no me gusta hacer planes a futuro porque luego no salen pero lo que mas deseo es darle estudios a mis hijos"

Este grupo agradece a la fundacion por el prestamo que se les ha otorgado.

los demas mienbros del grupo son:

Fabian  venta de refrescos 
rafael satreria 
irais taqueria 
rodrigo rotulos publicitarios
rodolfina venta de frutas  y legunbre 
maria juana venta de refrescos 
Maximina  venta de ropa
erika venta de antojitos mexicanos
texts.en:
Victoria is one of the members of a group called La Estacion which is made up of nine very close, hardworking and kind people. Each of these people has an economic activity which he or she does to get their families ahead and thus give them a better quality of life. This group is located in a community which is described as being in a sugar cane region. 

Victoria  is 27 years old. She only went to primary school and she is a single mother of two children. The oldest is named Rodolfo. He is 7 years old and goes to primary school. She also has a daughter named Alexandra, who is 6 and in pre-school. She tells us that she has always had to work to get her family ahead, but a little more than 8 months ago she opened a small grocery store in a locale that she has in the front part of her house. She sells there every day from eight in the morning until eight at night. Despite her business being new she already has a lot of customers in her neighborhood who buy from her. She needs this loan to invest in buying milk, eggs, detergents, beverages, candies, oil, beans, toilet paper, napkins, cookies, soup, coffee and sugar to re-stock her store. She hopes that when her business is better stocked she can attract more customers and increase her sales and earnings and continue to invest in the business and give her children a better quality of life. She said "I don't like to make plans for the future because then they don't turn out, but what I want the most is to give my children an education." 

This group s grateful to the foundation for the loan that it has been given.  

The other members of the group are:

Fabian:  selling beverages
Rafael: tailoring
Irais: selling tacos  
Rodrigo:  advertising logos
Rodolfina: selling fruits and vegetables 
Maria Juana: selling beverages 
Maximina: selling clothes 
Erika Venta: selling Mexican snacks

loans.use: to buy milk, eggs, detergents, beverages, candies, oil, beans, toilet paper, napkins, cookies, soup, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Mauricio Alberto

texts.es: Mauricio Alberto de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive con su compañera de vida en casa propia. El posee un pequeño negocio donde vende diferentes tipos de accesorios por servicios que presta a los clientes, últimamente ha tenido más demanda por su trabajo, pues es de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable; Mauricio es un hombre emprendedor con muchos deseos de superarse y cumplir todas sus metas, le gusta estar activo en su negocio por eso siempre se mantiene adelante de la competencia, para él lo más importante es la dedicación y el amor que se le da a la labor, quiere satisfacer a cada uno de sus clientes y hacer crecer el negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que permita comprar navajas, accesorios para celular, relojes entre otros. Mauricio tiene la confianza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mauricio Alberto is 44 years old and lives with his life partner in his own home.  He has a small business where he sells different types of accessories for services that he provides to his customers.  He has recently experienced an increase in demand as his products are very good quality and affordable.  In addition, his service is second to none.  Mauricio is an entrepreneurial man who has a great desire to do well and achieve all his goals.  He likes to be active in his business and this is why he is always ahead of the competition.  The most important thing for him is the commitment and love that he has for his work.  He would like to please all of his customers and grow his business.
