Ayub is a 36-year-old farmer who is married to Meriana, a 36-year-old lady. Ayub and Meriana are blessed with two children from their marriage, namely: Fenny, 14,  who is studying in the 2nd grade of Junior High School, and Ferdy, 11, who is studying at the 4th grade of Elementary School.

Ayub has been a farmer for years. From the job, Ayub is able to earn income to finance his children's schooling costs and households needs. He cultivates vegetables such as mustard greens, water spinach, tomatoes and cucumber at his farm. Ayub is lucky since his neighbor allows him to utilize part of the field to cultivate paddy. The income from the harvest will be shared equally with the landlord.
 
At the end of January Ayub spent his capital to plant rice and to buy the fertilizer. He plans to continue cultivating vegetables but he needs more money to buy more seedlings and fertilizer. Therefore he is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000. Ayub is hoping that TLM will help him through the loan assistance for his business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is taking another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost her clothes selling business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer demand in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Madame Coumba es âgée  de 44ans et vit au Sénégal. Elle gère u ne boutique de commerce de détail de produits cosmétiques a la devanture de sa maison.  C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par nécessité. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa zone d’habitation depuis 2 mois. Elle sollicite un prêt de 75 000 frs  prévu pour l’achat de nouveaux produits a  revendre. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre  ses bénéfices et d’améliorer son niveau de vie ainsi que celle de sa famille.
texts.en:
Coumba is 44 years old and lives in Senegal. She runs a shop selling cosmetics at the front of her house. She chose this business out of necessity.

Coumba has been a member of her local UIMCEC branch for 2 months. She is requesting a loan of 75 000 francs in order to buy new products for resale. This loan will enable her to increase her profits and improve her and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Sihame

texts.en: Sihame is a 32-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married, living with her husband and four school-aged children. She collaborates with her husband to meet the family demands. Her husband has been working with his own van since the year 2000. As for her, she has two years of experience in selling home products and has her own shop.  Today, she’s in need of a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added products such as Tupperware plastics and many other items in order to diversify her sales and gain a new range of customers, which will surely increase her profits. In the future, she plans to work as a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase added products such as Tupperware and many other items to diversify her sales

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 34-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children who are still attending school. She strives to work really hard to help her husband with their family expenses. She has been working as a clothes seller from her home since the year 2000. In parallel, she also works in a lingerie shop. As for her husband, he works as a taxi driver on a free-lance basis. 

Today, Fatmeh wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of clothes. This loan will increase her sales therefore her profits thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of clothes

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is a 45-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. Malek wishes to enhance his family’s way of living. For this reason, he works nonstop to be able to cover their heavy living expenses. He opened his own butchery in 1995. He’s a reputable person and always searches to deliver good and fresh products. 

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy the needed quantity of meat for his butchery. In that way, he will be able to develop his business and augment his sales. In the future, he plans to raise cattle and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy the needed quantity of meat for his butchery

loans.name: Wafik

texts.en: Wafik is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three school-aged children. He’s trying his best to satisfy his family's needs and provide help whenever they need it. He has been working as a plumber and painter since 1995. He works independently and visits his customers at home from time to time. He is looking to borrow money from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new painting tools and some plumbing equipment.  This will help him take on more projects and gain more customers. In the future, he plans to improve his job and take bigger projects.

loans.use: to buy new painting tools and some plumbing equipment

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en: Maysaa is a 45-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children. Three of her children are still attending school and the other one is working. Her husband is the main income provider in the family; he’s working outside the country at a local company. As for her, she opened her own lingerie shop in 2008. She has loyal customers and knows very well how to stay in good relations with them. She is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to diversify her merchandise selection of underwear, pajamas, bridal lingerie and many other items.  In the future, she plans to enlarge her shop to include women's clothing.

loans.use: to diversify her merchandise selection of underwear, pajamas, bridal lingerie and may other items

loans.name: Elva Francisca

texts.es:
Elba es una mujer de 53 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comida.

Su historia empezó desde 6 a 5 años atrás en su casa en horas de la tarde y ahora también vende los fines de semana en las mañanas es lo único que sabe saber, su trabajo lo hace sola el horario es de martes a viernes de 18:00 hasta las 22:00, sábado y domingo 6:00 hasta 13:00, si tiene dificultades que se llegase a enfermar, si está casada el esposo es mensajero en una empresa, si tiene hijos son mayores.

Su sueño más importante es aumentar el espacio físico de su casa para poder poner mesas para los clientes. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de comida y asi comprar carnes, granos, vegetales  etc.
texts.en:
Elba is a 53 year old woman who has many aspirations to prosper with her food sales business.

The story of her business began between 5 and 6 years ago at her home in the afternoons.  She also sells food on weekends in the morning.  It is all she knows.  She works alone and her schedule is from Tuesday to Friday 6 to 10pm, and Saturday and Sunday from 6am to 1pm.  If she has difficulties and gets sick, she has the advantage of a husband that works as a messenger for a company.  She has older sons as well.

Her most important dream is to expand the physical space in her house so that she can put out tables for the clients.  That is why she wants she wants this loan, for her food sale business, and through this to be able to buy meat, grains, and vegetables, etc.

loans.use: buy meat, grains, and vegetables.

loans.name: Laura Julissa

texts.es:
Laura una mujer de 32 años, es casada y tiene un pequeño de apenas 2 años, está muy contenta con su pequeña familia y el empeño que tienen ambos en sacar a esta nueva familia adelante. Actualmente su esposo es obrero de packing, actividad que le permite apoyar y mucho a Laura en los ingresos del hogar. 

Para salir adelante Laura tuvo la buena idea de iniciar una pequeña bodega, donde se dedicaría a la venta de todo tipo de productos comestibles a sus vecinos, es de esta manera como empezó en este tipo de negocio, al cual le dedica medio día debido a que también trabaja con una señora a la cual ayuda en su tienda.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Laura desea poder comprar productos líquidos, como gaseosas, re hidratantes, agua, etc. por temporada de verano, está muy contenta con esta nueva idea porque sabe que con el transcurso del tiempo y mejora de sus ingresas podrá crear un Mini market y luego de eso desea poder ponerlo en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Laura, 32, is married and has a 2-year old son.  She is very happy with her little family and works hard to support them.  Her husband works as a laborer and the couple share household expenses.  

Laura operates a corner shop where she sells all kinds of everyday products.  She started it because she needed a way to generate an income.  She works half of each day, sharing the running of the shop with another woman who works the other half.  

With help from Kiva lenders, Laura will stock her store with the products that her customers most want in summer--soft drinks, etc.  She is very happy with her progress and is confident that she will eventually be able to build a larger business.

loans.use: to stock her corner shop.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en: Asmahan is a 45-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three children who are still studying. She is cooperating with her husband in order to satisfy their needs and be capable to live as they are. She has owned a clothing shop since 2004 and has gained a fair number of customers so far. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added clothing such as dresses, scarves, pants and many other items. She notes that this loan will push her to get higher returns. In the future, she plans to open other branches.

loans.use: to purchase added clothing such as dresses, scarves, pants and many other items.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh is a 45-year-old Lebanese married man. He’s living with his wife and two school-aged children. He’s doing his best to be able to offer them a respectable life. He opened his own car oil and batteries shop in 2009 and has a variety of products. He also sells different types of tires. Today, he’s looking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of oil and batteries in addition to tires for his business. He notes that this will boost his sales and allow him earn superior income. In the future, he plans to better develop his business and increase his revenues.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of oil and batteries

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 38-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. To cover the heavy costs of life, they’re both joining forces in order to meet at least their necessary expenses. His wife has been working as a babysitter for fifteen years. As for him, he has been working in selling oil to the neighboring areas. 

Today, Houssam is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of oil for his business.  He really wishes a better future for his children and he thinks that this Kiva loan will increase his profits thus enhance his standard of living. In the future, he plans to open his own oil shop.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of oil for his business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 38-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are both studying. He’s the one supporting the family and they all depend on him. Ahmad took over  his family responsibilities on his own and decided to have his own business. He opened his own metal shop where he specifically cuts metal into different shapes depending on his customer’s requests. 

Today, Ahmad is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase metal supplies and tools for his work. He notes that this will facilitate his business operations and help him work in a proper way. In the future, he plans to take out another Kiva loan and renovate his shop.

loans.use: to purchase metal supplies and tools for his work

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en: Adnan is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are still studying. He’s considered as the main source of income for his family and is looking to offer them a fair way of living. He has been working as a van driver since 2005. He works independently, on a free-lance basis. Today, he wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy a new van for his business. This Kiva loan will allow him develop his work and therefore gain added customers. In the future, he plans to organize touristic trips all over the country.

loans.use: to buy a new van for his business

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en: Nahida is a 36-year-old Lebanese single woman living with only one working sister. They both cooperate together in order to enrich their life. Nahida started to work as a tailor from her home in 1994, after many years of experience in this domain. In parallel, she’s working in a local company.  Today, she’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new tailoring machine for her business.  This will allow her to increase her production thus her sales and therefore her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine for her business

loans.name: Didacienne

texts.en:
Didacienne is 45 years old, widowed, and has three children. She sells foodstuffs such as rice and cooking oil. 

Didacienne is requesting a loan to buy more rice and cooking oil to sell. She plans to build a house from the profits.

loans.use: tp purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Fabricio

texts.es:
Nelson, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, está soltero y vive con su madre y dos hermanos, él tiene la granja de cerdos en su vivienda, desde hace dos años está dedicado a esta actividad, lo aprendió por su madre, quien le apoya en lo necesario para realizar las labores.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, esta compra le permite mejorar y fortalecer la granja, ya que tendrá más oportunidades de venta en un futuro.
El objetivo de Nelson, es llevar por buen camino la granja, saliendo adelante con su familia y apoyándolos en cualquier necesidad.
texts.en:
Nelson earns a living raising and selling pigs.  He is single and lives with his mother and two brothers.  He has operated the business for two years and keeps the pigs in a sty behind his house.  His mother taught him the business and provided everything he needed to get started.
Nelson is applying for a loan that he will use to buy pigs and pig feed.  The investment will allow him to improve and strengthen his business, something he's keen to do because he sees opportunities ahead for expanding his sales.  
Nelson's goal for the future is to grow his business so that he can help support his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed for his animal sales business.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La socia continua con la compra y venta de artesanía, la socia teje chompas, casacas, chalinas y mantas,guantes entre otros productos artesanales para la venta, en esta ocasion la socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lanas y tambien ya mercaderia hecha al por mayor para continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en: Our member operates a business making and selling sweaters, blankets, gloves, etc.  She is applying for a new loan to buy wholesale stocks of wool and other supplies that she needs to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale stocks of wool and other supplies for her weaving business.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 30 years old. Vestine has spent six years running a little store where she has been selling various sorts of merchandise. She has requested a loan to buy more merchandise such as sugar, rice, beans and sorghum. She plans to use the profits to renovate the house and put aside savings as well.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en:
Joumana is a 39-year-old Lebanese woman. She married, living with her husband and five children. Four of the children are studying and the other is working. The whole family combines forces in order to gain superior income and therefore enhance their life. 

Joumana started to work as a tailor from her home in the year 2000. Her husband has been working as a private driver since 1995. Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new, full-option tailoring machine. She notes that this will help her develop her work and improve her designs.  In the future, she plans to work on new designs, boost her productivity and open her own evening dress shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new, full-option tailoring machine

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en: Stephanie is a widow who is 42 years old. She has two children who are 8 and 22 years old. Only the youngest attends school. She has spent seven years in business operating a boutique where she sells assorted products such as soaps, sugar, cooking oil, and rice. With the loan, she plans to buy more sugar and cooking oil to sell. Stephanie will use the profits for buying a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more soaps, sugar, cooking oil, and rice to sell

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is age 35. She has one child only. She owns a bar, which she has been running for six years. Joselyne has requested a loan to add more beers in the bar. She wants to use the profits for renovating the house. She dreams of having a very extensive bar in the future.

loans.use: to buy more beers to sell

loans.name: Violette

texts.en: Violette is age 36. She has five children who are between 3 and 10 years old. Four of them attend school. Violette sells beans, and she has spent four years in the business. Violette has requested the loan to buy more beans to sell, and she plans to use the profits for paying school fees and providing food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell

loans.name: Saydali

texts.ru: Сайдали проживает в районе Муминобод. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а дети маленькие. Сам он таксист, он предоставляет услугу.. В этой области он пять лет. Кроме того Сайдали занимается животноводством. Он берет кредит для ремонта автомашины и закупа коровы.
texts.en: Saydali lives in the Muminobod region. He is 42 years old, married, and has four children. His wife takes care of the household, and his children are still very young. Saydali has been offering his services as a cab driver for five years. He also raises livestock. Saydali is taking this loan to repair his vehicle and to purchase a cow.

loans.use: to repair his taxi and to purchase a cow

loans.name: Saul Alberto

texts.es:
Saúl, se dedica a la venta de conchas, él vive con su esposa y tres hijos de los cuales dos están estudiando, el negocio de Saúl es la comercialización de conchas en los mercados tiene más de un año de dedicarse a este negocio. 
Él esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de conchas al por mayor y para tener dinero para el pago de transporte, este préstamo ayudara a que Saúl continúe en su negocio ya que depende su familia de su trabajo.
Sus sueños es cambiar el negocio para instalar una granja de gallinas ponedoras, para no salir tanto de casa y tener una fuente de ingreso segura.
texts.en:
Saul works selling clams.  He lives with his wife and three children, of which two are studying.  Saul's business is the sale of clams in the markets.  He has been working in this business for more than a year.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy clams in bulk and to have money for transport.  This loan will help Saul to continue with his business since his family depends on his work.

His dreams include changing the business to install a farm of egg-laying hens so that he won't have to leave home so often and to have a secure source of income.

loans.use: Buy clams in bulk and pay for transport.

loans.name: Jeannette Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jeannette, vive acompañada de su esposo y un hijo de un año de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pollo frito, tiene tres  años de estar en el negocio, lo atiende en el mercado, de este negocio ha ganado muchas amistades y clientes, ha logrado mantener a su familia, el pollo lo compra crudo y lo prepara para empanizarlo, luego vende las piezas.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pollos crudo para vender, con esto podrá obtener una buena cantidad para mantener el negocio y prepararlo , esto le ayudara para que sus ventas sean mejor.
La aspiración de Jeanette, es crecer y que su familia mejore económicamente, velar por sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Jeannette lives together with her husband and her one-year-old son.  Her business is selling fried chicken.  She has been in her business for three years and works in the market.  Her business has made her a lot of friends and customers and enabled her to support her family.  She buys her chicken raw, prepares it, coats it in breadcrumbs and sells it in pieces.

Jeannette is requesting a loan to buy raw chicken.  She will be able to buy a good quantity to prepare.  This will help her to improve her sales.

Jeannette's goal is to grow her business, improve her family's financial situation and take care of their needs.

loans.use: to buy chicken

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, vive con una hija de 22 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa en revistas, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, tiene 4 años de estar en él, tiene una buena experiencia y hasta la fecha no ha tenido inconvenientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos de belleza como maquillajes, labiales, cremas, tambien perfumería, lociones, que pedira a las agencias de las revistas, con esta compra surtirá el negocio y mejorara la atención a los clientes.
La aspiración de Juana es que su negocio este en mejores condiciones, ya que esto le permitirá tambien mejorar la condición económica familiar y poder cancelar este préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana lives with her 22-year-old daughter.  Her business is selling beauty products and clothing through catalogs.  She started the business on her own initiative and has been working in it for four years.  She has good experience and, up to now, she hasn't experienced any difficulties.

Juana is requesting a loan to buy beauty products such as make-up, lipsticks, creams, perfume and lotions which she will order from the catalog agents.  This purchase will enable her to stock her business and improve her customer service.

Juana's goal is to improve her business so that she can improve her family's financial situation and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy make-up, lipsticks, creams, perfume and lotions

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 49-year-old Lebanese divorced man living with his only child who is working. He strives to work really hard to be able to fulfill their needs and live as it should be.  Abbas opened his own shoe repair shop in 2005. He also sells military shoes upon request.  Today, he’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new collection of military shoes for his shop in addition to some repair tools. He notes that this loan will certainly push him to get higher returns. In the future, he plans to open other branches as soon as possible and target a wider range of clients.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of military shoes for his shop in addition to some repair tools

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en: Daphrose, aged 49, is a mother of 6 children and all go to school. She owns a general store which she has been running for 10 years. She plans to use the new loan to buy more items such as sugar, rice, mineral water and sodas. With the profits, she will pay school fees and put aside savings.

loans.use: To buy more items such as sugar, rice and mineral water and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 39 years old. She has four children who are all enrolled in school. Ruth owns a boutique which she has been running for four years. With the loan, she will add more items in the boutique, such as sugar, soaps, and salt. She hopes to use the profits to pay school fees for the children and provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more items such as sugar, soaps, and salt to sell

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor es una mujer de 44 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de productos AVON. 

Su historia empezó porque siempre ha sido independiente y me gustado trabajar por eso me dedique a la venta de AVON y trabajo como tutora, su trabajo lo hace sola, si tiene dificultades son la delincuencia y el transporte, no está casada, si tiene 1 hija estudia en escuela fiscal y me ayuda con el negocio, su sueño más importante es mejorar el negocio comprar una vitrina y ser líder del grupo. 

Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de productos AVON y comprar asi cosmeticos, perfumes, cremas para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Flor is a 44 year old woman with has great aspirations for success selling AVON products in the coming years. 

Her story begins because she has always been independent and has enjoyed working. Because of this, she has decided to sell AVON products and work as a tutor. She works by herself. If she has challenges, they lie in delinquency and in transportation. 

She is not married and has one daughter who attends public school. Her daughter helps her with her business. 

Her most important dreams are to improve her business, purchase a display cabinet, and become leader of the group. To do so, Flor wants the loan to purchase cosmetics, perfumes, and creams in order to improve AVON product sales and generate more income.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics, perfumes, and creams

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is 27 years old, single. He owns a bar which he has been running for the last two years. He has requested the loan to buy more beers to sell in the bar. He wants to build a house from the profits he will make from the business. He would like to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beers to sell.

loans.name: Elva Rosalía

texts.es: Elva es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad, se dedica al transporte de flete y agregados, es una socia puntual y es muy trabajadora, pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos sola, y tener la satisfacción de tenerlos profesionales, es muy responsable y le encanta las capacitaciones porque le ayudaron a enseñarles valores a sus hijos, el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para su negocio.
texts.en: Elva is a member of the Prosperidad (Prosperity) Communal Bank. She owns a transportation business ans she also sells aggregates. She is a punctual and very hardworking member; she has succeeded in providing for her children by her own means, and they are all professionals now, something she is satisfied with. She is very responsible and she loves the seminars because through them she has transmitted her values to her children. She will invest the loan in the purchase of spare parts for her activity.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her activity.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, está soltero, tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su madre y sus hermanos, su trabajo es decorador en eventos sociales, este negocio surgió por que ayudaba a una amiga a realizar los recuerdos y decoraciones, esto le ayudo para decidirse por instalar su propio negocio. 
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un arco decorativo, tambien comprara tela para decorar unas 20 yardas, además de flores artificiales, recuerdos prefabricados, y decoraciones para pared. Este préstamo será un gran aporte para él pues tendrá lo necesario en su negocio para poder prestar los servicios de decoración.
El objetivo de Luis es tener su propio negocio, libre de deudas, que sea auto sostenible, tambien tener más clientela y darse a conocer a otras zonas.
texts.en:
Luis is single, 28 years old, and lives with his mother and siblings.  He works as a social events decorator.  He started out in this business helping a [female] friend make party favors and decorations.  He then decided to set up his own business.

Luis is requesting a loan to buy a decorative arch.  He will also buy enough fabric to decorate 20 yards, artificial flowers, pre-made party favors and wall decorations.  This loan will be very helpful as he will have what he needs for his business and be able to provide his decoration services.

Luis' goal is to own his own self-sustaining business, free of debt.  He would also like to have more customers and become known in other areas.

loans.use: to buy a decorative arch, fabric, artificial flowers and pre-made party favors

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Tomasa; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales uno es independiente y la menor de sus hijos tiene 19 años de edad; La socia le sigue apoyando en sus estudios. La socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes ella tambien vende de forma independiente ropa, la socia viaja compra ropa para damas y caballeros y los reparte a sus amistades y a sus cleintes. La socia en esta ocasion desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de ropa y en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para implementar  su tiend ade abarrotes.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “Huayna Picchu.”  The bank is located in Cusco District, which belongs to Cusco Department.


The member is Sra. Tomasa.  She is 50 years old, is single and has 2 children of whom one lives independently and the younger is 19 years old.  The member supports her youngest in her schooling.  Sra. Tomasa has a small grocery store and also sells clothing on her own.  She travels to purchase men's and women's clothing and distributes them to friends and customers.  The member wants a loan at this time to invest in the purchase of clothing and basic needs products to stock her grocery.


The member is grateful to those who form a part of her dream through their loans, and she promises to comply with her established re-payment plan.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of clothing and basic needs products to stock her grocery.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: La socia Hilaria; continua con su negocio de compra y venta de golosinas, la socia a crecido mucho y ahora desea poder implementar sus carreta en esta temporada en la cual ya empiezan las clases escolares y poder tener todo lo que sus pequeños clientes gustan, ella invertira el prestamo en la compra de golosinas como dulces, chocolates, chupetines, galletas, productos de snack, jugos en cajas, yogutr personales y gaseosas.
texts.en: Hilaria continues working in her business buying and selling sweet treats.  She has grown her business a lot and now she would like to stock her cart for the back-to-school season so that she has everything her young customers enjoy.  She will invest her loan in buying candies, sweets, lollipops, cookies, snacks, cartons of juice, individual yogurts and soda.

loans.use: to buy candies, sweets, chocolates, lollipops, cookies, snacks, cartons of juice, individual yogurts and soda

loans.name: Faalupega

texts.en:
Faalupega Gogo, a 21-year-old single woman living in the town of Faala, earns a living by planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years, earning approximately 1200 WST a month.

In 2011, Faalupega joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD that was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment, she is now requesting a second loan for 1500 WST to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. Faalupega plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Iuni

texts.en:
Iuni Paulo (0) is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu TAI. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. Iuni owns & operates a fishing business.The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Iuni has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2012, Iuni joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Iuni is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. This will be Iuni's 1st loan from SPBD.  Iuni plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Fia

texts.en:
Fia Aufai (0) is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Saleaula. She is married and has 5 adult children. Fia owns & operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting fruits, vegetabels and taro to sell. Fia has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Fia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Fia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2400 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  

Fia is now requesting a new loan of 2900 WST, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  This will be the 5th loan taken out by Fia from SPBD. Fia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loretta is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of Safotu. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Loretta owns & operates a business raising crops, which involves planting & harvesting taro for sale. Loretta has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1000 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Loretta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Loretta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  Loretta is requesting a new loan of 1000 WST, which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Loretta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.en:
Maria Teodora, who is named after her grandmothers, is 48 years old and married. Her three children have all completed high school, which makes her very proud. For 12 years, Maria has been earning a living by selling food such as chuchitos (small corn tamales), bread with chicken, atole, toast, enchiladas, and other traditional foods of the region.

With hard work and determination, Maria was able to purchase a small store in the market two years ago, which she now operates from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Monday through Saturday. While her sales have increased, Maria depleted all of her savings in order to purchase the store. Looking for a small loan to be able to purchase more materials, Maria decided to join the Seagulls Trust Bank, comprised of seven members who have 29 children among them. Their businesses range from restaurants to veterinary assistance to tortilla-making. Like Maria, they are all striving to make a better life for their families.

Maria, who has expanded her product line to include purified water, sodas, smoothies and meals, hopes to one day have a larger store to accommodate more customers. "My group and I feel fortunate that people in other countries, who don't even know us, are willing to support us financially," said Maria. "Our families are benefiting, which is our goal. We can accomplish great things in our country if we have the support from others and we continue to work hard."

loans.use: to purchase more materials for food-making.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is a mother of two children. She is 50 years old. She has owned a little shop for 10 years where she sells different items such as sugar, rice, salt and soap. With the loan she wants to add more such items for her shop. She plans to use the profits for buying cows which can provide milk for the family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and soap to sell.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie, aged 35, has 2 children. She has been running a little restaurant for the past two years. With the new loan she wants to buy more foodstuffs which will be used to make and prepare food in the restaurant. She hopes to set up a small shop from the profits she anticipates from the restaurant business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Sola

texts.en:
Sola is a 18-year-old woman living in the town of Paia. She is married and does not have any chlidren. Sola owns & operates a business venture, raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting taro for sale. Sola has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2012, Sola joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Sola is requesting a loan of 1000 WST from SPBD for the first time. This loan will be used to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. Sola plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Seluia

texts.en:
Seluia is a 31-year-old. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Seluia owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Seluia has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 800 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Seluia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Seluia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1950 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.  Seluia is requesting a new loan of 2450 WST, which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Seluia from SPBD.  Seluia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Gereltuya

texts.en:
Gereltuya, 31 years old, lives with her husband and two children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Selenge province, Mongolia. Her husband is employed, and her children are both in school.

Gereltuya started her clothing and bag-retailing business in 2008, and over the years has gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. She is well known for her high quality and highly fashionable products.

Now that her business is stable, Gereltuya wants to extend her range of products. She has rented a stall in the local market, and in the future wants to make her own store of the clothes. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity, 39 years old and single, lives in Murang’a in Central Kenya, where she has practiced mixed farming for 12 years in addition to running a retail shop business. Her farm produces tea and vegetables which she sells locally. Droughts have and continue to be her main challenge.

Charity has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water pump. She says this will help her to pump water into her vegetable farm and increase her production. It will also reduce her farmhand costs since the water will be pumped.

loans.use: to buy a water pump

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en:
Sokhan (in the photo) sells Cambodian cake in her village. Her husband, Mean, is a construction contractor. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and two daughters- one child is a garment worker, another one has full-time employment, two are security guards and another one attends grade 6.

Sokhan is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to rebuild the house where she lives because the house is old and breaks, so she decided to make the rebuild.

loans.use: to rebuild the house where she lives.

loans.name: Elsy Marilu

texts.es:
Elsy, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, tostadas y panes con pollo, ella vive con su esposo y un hijo de 6 años de edad, este negocio lo tiene desde hace dos años, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 7:00pm, pues sus ventas de productos comestibles le permiten mantenerse todo el día con atención a los clientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos como pollos, condimentos, aceite, chicharrón, entre otros productos para el negocio. Esta compra le ayudara para mantener lo necesario y poder brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes.
La aspiración de Elsy es ayudar a su hijo, en sus estudios, por eso se esfuerza realizando las ventas a diario.
texts.en:
Elsy sells “pupusas” (a popular Salvadoran dish), tortilla snacks, and bread stuffed with chicken. She lives with her husband and 6-year-old son. Elsy has had the business for 2 years. She works every day from 7:00 am until 7:00 pm. Her sales of food products allow her to keep at it all day, providing attentive service to her customers.

Elsy is requesting a loan to buy products such as chicken, condiments, cooking oil, and pork cracklings, among other supplies for her business. This purchase will help her to maintain what's necessary in stock and offer better service to her customers.

Elsy's aspiration is to help her son continue his studies. That's why she works selling her meals each day.

loans.use: buy products for preparing meals to sell: chicken, condiments, cooking oil, and pork cracklings.

loans.name: Horloosuren

texts.en: Horloosuren is 53 years old and lives with her son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband passed away recently. Her son is a college student. Horloosuren started a meat trading business in 2006. Over the years she gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. Now that the Mongolian holiday season is approaching, her product demand is increasing. Therefore, she's requesting 800,000 MNT to buy additional supplies. She's a strong and hardworking woman who says, "It has been a big impact for us the fact that my husband passed away. However, that doesn't mean that I should feel sorry for myself and stop working. Instead, I have to work even harder."

loans.use: to buy more meat

loans.name: Seela

texts.en:
Seela is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Saleia. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. Seela owns & operates a business involving making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community. Seela has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Seela joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Seela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand the product offering.  Seela is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase a frying pan, flour, yeast, baking powder, plastic bags and cooking oil for her business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Seela from SPBD. Seela plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand Seela's business.

loans.use: to purchase frying pan, flour, yeast, baking powder, plastic bags and cooking oil.

loans.name: Divina Misericordia Group

texts.es:
Divina misericordia es el grupo formado por 14 mujeres de Ciudad del Este. Ellas son vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad, y comentan que oyeron hablar del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya y su deseo es poder trabajar juntas y de esa forma ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Una de las miembros es la Sra. Ignacia, y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de toda clase de marcas. Comenzó con la venta a solo los vecinos, pero después se abrió camino y hoy en día ya es una microempresaria exitosa y con muy buena clientela.  Su deseo es poder seguir trabajando, y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de cosméticos, con lo cual podrá surtirse y de es forma cumplir con loso pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
"Divina Misericordia" (Divine Mercy) is a group that consists of 14 women who are friends and neighbors from Ciudad del Este. They say that they heard a speech about the Women Entrepreneurs Program with Fundación Paraguaya. Their hope is to work together and be able to help one another.

One of the members is Sra. Ignacia. She says that she sells cosmetics of all types and brands. She started out selling only to neighbors, but afterwards she created a route and today she is already a successful microentrepreneur with a good customer base. Her wish is to continue working. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy cosmetics. This will allow her to restock so that she can fulfill the orders of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for eventual resale.

loans.name: Moriku

texts.en:
Moriku is a 36 year-old business man, who lives in Juba Nimule. He is married with two children who are 16 and 14 years old; both of them go to school. 

Moriku runs a food store business; he has been in the business for two years. He has no employees. Moriku heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients as well through outreach and promotion carried out by the loans officers. He is taking a loan of SDG 600 to purchase more items like dry cells, sweets, soap, pens, and many others. In addition to this business; Moriku has no other source of income.

In five years time, Moriku hopes for a big food store in the market.  His major challenges include school fees and home expenses.

Moriku says that he is happy for finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more items like dry cells, sweets, soap, pens, and many others.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Siufaga. She is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Joan owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling cooked food in the local community. Joan has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,500 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Joan joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Joan is now requesting a loan of 1,500 WST, which will be used to purchase a box of chicken, sausages, plastic plates and foil.  This is the second loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Joan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, sausages, plastic plates and foil.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is an 18-year-old woman living in the town of Patamea. She is married and does not have any children. Selina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Selina has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2012, Selina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Selina is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Selina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Oyuntsetseg is 50 years old and lives with her husband and 3 kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Selenge province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business. Two of the kids are employed and the youngest one is a college student. Oyuntsetseg started her consumer retailing business in 2000 by renting a counter in the market. She sells items such as towels, flashlights, hairpins, bandeaus and socks, etc.. She is well known by her quality products and low prices. Over the years, she gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my boy joined a college, I have to work even harder in order to support him." She's requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy additional supplies.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies

loans.name: Oyuntungalag

texts.en:
Oyuntungalag is 32 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Selenge province, Mongolia. Her husband is employed, and her daughter is a student.

Oyuntungalag started her shoe-retailing business in 2010 by renting a counter in the market. She buys her supplies, which are handpicked, of high quality and relatively inexpensive, from China, therefore earning her many customers. She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy additional supplies to meet the growing customer demand. A sharp and hardworking woman, Oyuntungalag says, "I have a mission to open my own shoe store someday."

loans.use: to purchase spring shoes.

loans.name: Finauvale

texts.en:
Finauvale is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Taga. She is married and has 2 grown children. Finauvale owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Finauvale has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Finauvale joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Finauvale has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD. The previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Finauvale is requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase freezer goods or meat such as mutton flaps, chicken, sausages to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Finauvale from SPBD. She  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase freezer goods or meat such as mutton flaps, chicken, sausages to sell.

loans.name: Perenise

texts.en:
Perenise is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Tai. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Perenise owns & operates a fishing business, harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Perenise has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 450 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Perenise joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Perenise has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 WST from SPBD. Perenise is requesting a second loan of 1800 WST, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Perenise plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: This time Remedios is borrowing PHP 10,000 to fund her general store business. The general store that she previously funded, through NWTF and KIVA, continues to provide Remedios and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
This is 32 year old Mabinty. She is a widow and has 2 children, aged 6 and 11. 

In 2008, Mabinty established her drinks and provisions business. She began her business because she was out of a job. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL4,000,000. Mabinty requires a loan in order to buy more drinks. In the future, Mabinty plans to buy piece of land and build a house for herself. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks.

loans.name: Sulufaiga

texts.en:
Sulufaiga is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Tai. She is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Sulufaiga owns & operates a service-based business providing taxi services to local community members. Sulufaiga has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Sulufaiga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Sulufaiga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2450 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Sulufaiga is now requesting a loan of 2850 WST, which will be used to purchase new tyres, service vehicle and taxi registration fees. This is the be the 5th loan taken out by Sulufaiga from SPBD. Sulufaiga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new tyres, service vehicle and taxi registration fees.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en: Rodelyn is applying for a loan of PHP 11,000, with which she intends to buy fertilizers and farm tools. The hog raising business, that she previously funded through KIVA and NWTF, continues to provide Rodelyn and her family with an income. She continues to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm tools.

loans.name: Conileus

texts.en: This is 46 year old Cornelius. He is married and has 2 children, aged 2 and 23 yrs. In 2006, he established his Entertainment Center, showing football matches and providing bar services. He began his business because he was out of a job. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000,000. Cornelius requires this loan in order to buy more drinks. He plans to improve more on this business and to buy another satellite dish to show many games. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks.

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy is married and has 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Precy is 30 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

Precy has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount, through NWTF, to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Precy has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Precy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ma.aracelli

texts.en: This time, for her seventh loan, Ma. Araceli is borrowing PHP 14,000 to fund her vegetable farming business. The farming business that she previously funded, through NWTF ad KIVA, continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Salieu

texts.en:
This is 47 year old Salieu. He is married and has 3 children, aged 1, 7, and 10 years. He has 1 additional dependent.  

In 2000, Salieu established his electrical and building materials business. He began his business because he was not educated. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL1,1000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000,000. Salieu requires a loan in order to buy more building materials in large quantities at a reduced rate. In the future, Salieu plans to open another outlet to be managed by his wife. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to improve on business.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr: L’emprunteur s’appelle Salimata ; elle est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle   fait du commerce depuis 10 ans. Elle travaille avec le guichet depuis un bon bout de temps car elle a déjà eu 2 crédits. Son activité consiste à acheter pour revendre des habits, de l’encens, des chaussures, de la crème pour le corps. Salimata a comme charges : le payement de la facture de l’électricité ; et c’est comme cela qu’elle appui son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes  de la famille. Avec son époux qui se débrouille, Salimata à pour  objectif d’améliorer les conditions de vie de son foyer.
texts.en:
The borrower is called Salimata. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She has been involved in commerce for 10 years.

Salimata has been working with the UIMCEC branch for a long while as she has already received 2 loans. Her business consists of buying and selling clothes, incense, shoes and body cream. Her financial obligations include paying the electricity bill, which is her way of supporting her husband in the management of the family's daily expenses. With her husband just getting by, Salimata aims to improve the living conditions of her household.

loans.use: to buy clothing, incense, shoes and body cream for resale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa que es de su propiedad, y esta ubicada en un caserío rural de nombre “Sialupe-Humantanga” perteneciente al distrito de Lambayeque el cual esta a unos 15 minutos de la Ciudad de Chiclayo. En el caserío donde vive la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales.

Su actividad principal de Juana es dedicarse a la crianza, engorde y posterior comercialización de animales como. Ganado ovino, caprino, y aves de corral en su gran mayoría, los cuales al alcanzar el peso y tamaño ideal los ofrece en mercados de su caserío en donde ya tiene clientes fijos que son comerciantes de los mismos mercados.
Adicionalmente a eso se genera ingresos diarios vendiendo chicha de jora (bebida oriunda de los Incas), actividad que viene desarrollando ya un aproximado de 5 años.

Ahora Juana esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el mejor engorde y crecimiento rápido de sus animales y poder ponerlos a mejor precio, así de esa manera Juana obtendrá mayores ingresos con los que pueda cumplir con sus responsabilidades y de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana is 49 years old and she and her husband have their own home and live there along with their two children.  The house is located in the rural settlement of “Sialupe-Humantanga,” which is part of the Lambayaque district, located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  Most of the residents in her settlement raise and sell animals.

Juana’s principle activity is the raising and selling of livestock, such as sheep, goats, and coral birds in large numbers.  She sells them in the local markets where she has steady customers and who also sell things in the same markets.

She also generates income by selling corn chicha (a fermented drink of the Incas), and she’s been doing this for five years.

Juana is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa, to buy balanced feed to better promote the growth of her livestock and be able to offer them at better prices.  In this way she can increase her income, allowing her to better meet her financial obligations, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Ma.ruby

texts.en:
Ma. Ruby is 33 years old and married. She has 2 children.

Ma. Ruby works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods like snack foods, groceries and other miscellaneous items.

Ma. Ruby has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Ma. Ruby aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods like snack foods, groceries and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lea has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

In the future, Lea would like to save enough to build a house for her family and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Darika

texts.ru: Дарике 55 лет, имеет  троих детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, четыре года назад Дарика начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Дарики, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется две дойные коровы и пятнадцать овец, что позволяет получать примерно 8,000 сом с продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дарика обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и коз. Доходы Дарика планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Darika is 55 years old. She has three children. In the search of an income source for her family, four years ago Darika launched a livestock business with the starting capital of 5,000 KGS.Thanks to Darika’s hard work, her farm today has two dairy cows and 15 sheep, which allows her to earn about 8,000 KGS from sales of dairy and meat products. In order to grow her business further, Darika turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 40,000 KGS for the purpose of buying sheep and goats. Darika plans to reinvest her revenues in expanding her livestock further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Niño Salvador Group

texts.es:
Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, ellas son las integrantes del grupo Niño Salvador, el cual está integrado por 19 mujeres de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Ellas desean un mejor porvenir para sus hijos, para que de esa forma no pasen por privaciones como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar.
La Sra. Lidia es una persona que se destaca por su entusiasmo y su espíritu progresista, ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de carbón, que ultimanete tiene mucha venta. Comenta que sus vecinos y personas de otras zonas compran de ella lo que vende, y es por ello que le va muy bien. Con mucho sacrificio y lucha ha logrado estar en en lugar en que se encuentra.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de carbón, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener mayor producto en stock. Está muy contenta por formar parte del programa de la fundación.
texts.en:
These individuals are known in their area as hardworking and determined women. They are from the group Niño Salvador (Savior Child), which consists of 19 women from the city of San Lorenzo. They desire a better future for their children, so they work in this manner in order for their children to avoid experiencing the same hardships that they had to endure.

Sra. Lidia is a person who is known for her enthusiasm and her progressive spirit. She says that she sells charcoal and generates many sales. Lidia says that her neighbors and people from other areas buy what she sells. For this reason, she has done very well. With great sacrifice and determination, she has been able to get to the place where she is now. She is requesting a loan to buy charcoal so that she can restock and have more inventory. Lidia is pleased to be part of the program with Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for eventual resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old and married with three children.

Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, rice, and other miscellaneous items.

Grace has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending and hog raising.

Grace aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, rice, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Tagaymurod

texts.ru: Тагаймурод проживает в районе Муминобод. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он занимается перевозкой и развозкой пассажиров. В этой области он четыре года. Тагаймурод берет кредит для ремонта машины.
texts.en: Tagaymurod lives in the Muminobod district.  He is 49 years old, married and has four children.  He is involved in transportation and passenger taxi services.  He has been in this business for four years.  Tagaymurod is requesting this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Sang

texts.ru: Санг занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом он открыл не большой магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара. В этой области он шесть лет. Ему 56 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Он берет кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Sang is involved in sales.  He opened a small store with a mixed assortment of merchandise near his house.  He has been in this business for six years.  Sang is 56 years old, married and has one child.  He is requesting this loan to increase product turnover.

loans.use: to purchase necessary products

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo, sus hijos están ya separados pero le ayudan económicamente, ella se dedica a atender un negocio de productos domésticos, tiene 6 años en el negocio y lo instalo para tener una entrada de dinero y una ocupación que le ayudara para apoyar a su esposo. 
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos para surtir la tienda como boquitas, galletas, dulces, embutidos, huevos, jabón, detergentes, con esta compra lograra diversificar los productos y así mejorar las ventas.
La aspiración de María es ampliar su tienda, aumentar el número  de clientes y así generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband.  Her children no longer live with her, but they help her financially.  She works at a small business selling household products.  She began the business six years ago to have a source of income and a job to help support her husband.  She is requesting this loan to buy products to stock the store, such as snacks, cookies, candy, deli meats, eggs, soap, and detergent.  With this purchase she will be able to diversify her products and thus improve sales.

Maria's aspiration is to expand her store, increase her number of clients, and so generate more income.

loans.use: to buy snacks, cookies, candy, deli meats, eggs, soap, and detergent.

loans.name: Elvia Idaluz

texts.es:
Elvia es una mujer de 54 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de producto esika "empresa de cosmeticos y ropa por catalogo".

Su historia empezó luego que se separo de su esposo se dio cuenta que tenía que trabajar para sus hijos, su trabajo lo hace sola en el horario que requiera el cliente, si tiene dificultades son la inseguridad de las calles al entregar sus productos, no está casada, si tiene hijos son mayores de edad, su sueño más importante es tener su casa terminada la mitad es para mí y la otra parte es para alquilar. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de cosméticos, perfumes y cremas.
texts.en:
Elvia is a 54-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her business selling Esika products (catalog cosmetics and clothing) over the next few years.

Elvia's business story started when she separated from her husband and realized that she had to work to support her children.  She works alone and her work hours depend on her customers' needs.  The difficulty she faces is the lack of safety in the streets when she goes out delivering her products.  Elvia is not married and her children are adults. Her biggest dream is to finish building her home.  She will live in half of the house and rent out the other half.  She would like this loan to buy cosmetics, perfume and creams.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfume and creams

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Abdul. He is married and has one child, aged 7 months. He has four additional dependents.  

In 2004, Abdul established his provisions and drinks business. He began his business because after his high school education, there was no job. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about Le 1,428,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Abdul requires a loan in order to buy more stock. In the future, Abdul plans to erect his own house and open a bigger shop. He is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks and provisions.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gloria is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy more piglets and feed.

Gloria has been raising pigs for twenty-four years and also earns additional income from a coffee shop.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
56-year-old Mario lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family. He is married and has children.

Mario has been in the business of raising hogs for five years. He built a backyard piggery that he hopes to expand in the future. Mario earns about 10,000 PHP per month raising pigs. He works hard to provide his family with a better life. 

He plans to use his loan to purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins. Mario hopes to have a progressive business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Nery Rosaura

texts.es:
Nery es una mujer de 57 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su comedor-asadero.

Su historia empezó haciendo venta de almuerzo porque se separo de esposo y emprendió y emprendió un negocio de venta de almuerzo actualmente también tiene un asadero, su trabajo lo hace con su hija y mi horario es de lunes a sábado desde las 7:30 hasta las 18:00, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, si tiene 6 hijos son mayores de edad, su sueño más importante es incrementar el negocio de comidas. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su negocio de comidas y asi comprar carnes, granos, bebidas.
texts.en:
Nery is a woman of 57 who has many ambitions for making her eatery and grill prosper in the coming years.

Her story begins with her selling lunches, because she separated from her husband, and launched a business selling lunches. Now she also has a grill. She works with her daughter, Monday to Saturday from 7:30am until 6:00pm. She doesn't have any difficulties in her business. She isn't married and has six adult children. 

Her most important dream is to increase her food business. That is why she wants the loan for her food business, in order to buy meat, grains, and drinks.

loans.use: To buy meat, grains, and drinks.

loans.name: Esther Elvira

texts.es:
Esther Elvira tiene 45 años vive en Union Libre, vive con el compañero tiene 7 hijos pero con ella solo viven 4 por que los demas son casado y viven fuera del recinto Sinabamba.

La ventanilla se llama SANABAMBA se encuentra ubicado en la Parroquia La Magdalena perteneciente al Canton Chimbo a 15 minutos de la oficina, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz.

Esther se dedica a la siembra de maiz, trigo y cebada en terrenos propios y una parte en terrenos arrendados, las compras las realiza en Comercial Prado.

El credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos como: urea, liquidos para curar las enfermedades de los cultivos y para semillas. El dinero le apoyado de gran manera por que a aumentado por ingresos en la produccion y para la familia, el sueño es ayudar a los hijos a terminar el estudio y seguir cosechando.

Le gusta trabajar tener animales para cuidar.
texts.en:
Esther Elvira is 45 years old and has a common-law marriage.  She lives with her husband and has seven children.  She only lives with four of her children as the others are married and no longer live at home with her in Sinabamba.

This community bank is called 'Sanabamba' and it is located in La Magdalena parish, in Chimbo canton, 15 minutes from our office.  The members of the bank work in farming, growing corn.

Esther grows corn, wheat and barley.  She grows some of her crops on land which she owns and some on rented land.  She makes her purchases in Prado Shopping Center.

Esther is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as urea, liquids for combating crop disease, and seeds.  The money has been a great support to her as she has increased her income for her family.  Esther's dream is to help her children finish their studies and to continue farming.  She enjoys working and having animals to care for.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquids for combating crop disease, and seeds

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 55 years old and married with seven children.

Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Emma has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from a vulcanizing shop.

Emma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Emely works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Emely is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, and other groceries for her general store business.

Emely has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Khisrav

texts.ru: Хисрав житель города Куляб. Ему 25 лет. Он холост. Его отец милиционер, а брат находится в Российской Федерации. Сам Хисрав занимается скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается полтора года. Кредит берет для закупа бычков с целью увеличения количества скота.
texts.en: Khisrav is a resident of the city of Kulob.  He is 25 years old, single.  His father is a policeman, and brother is in the Russian Federation.  Khisrav is involved in animal husbandry.  He has been in this business for a year and a half.  He is requesting this loan to purchase bulls in order to increase livestock quantities.

loans.use: to purchase bulls

loans.name: Mavdjuda

texts.ru: Мавджуда жительница района Дангара. Ей 33 года. Она вдова. У нее четверо детей. Она занимается торговлей. В основном она ходит по селам и продает детскую и мужскую одежду. Торговлей она занимается шесть лет. Также Мавджуда занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Она берет кредит для покупки сезонной одежды.
texts.en: Mavdjuda is a resident of the Dangara district.  She is 33 years old, a widow and has four children.  She is involved in sales and primarily goes to villages to sell children's and men's clothing.  She has been involved in sales for six years.  Mavdjuda is also involved in sewing national dresses.  She is requesting this loan to purchase seasonal clothing.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Cesar Agusto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr.  Cesar; es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; el socio es empresario minorista, el tiene un stand en uno d elos centros artesanales, el socio fabrica polos, casacas, busos, poleras con diseños andinos y tambien con caricaturas, el socio tiene una fabrica de confeccion y el distribuye al por mayor todo sus trabjo, el socio es un hombre muy trabajador y desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de telas, y de serigrafias para continuar con sus confecciones y distribuirlas por toda la ciudad. El socio compra telas y hilos para la fabricacion de sus polos, poleras, casacas.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Cesar is a member of 'Huayna Picchu' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Cesar is single and has two children.  He is a retail businessman and has a stand in a craft center.  He makes polo shirts, jackets, track suits and turtleneck sweaters with Andean designs and figures.  He has a clothing factory and distributes his products wholesale.  Cesar is a very hard-working man and he would like to invest his loan in buying fabrics and silk screen prints so that he can continue making his clothing and distributing it around the city.  He will buy fabric and threads for making his polo necks, turtlenecks and jackets.
