Cesar is grateful to those who will take part in his dream in this way and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads for making polo shirts, turtleneck sweaters and jackets

loans.name: Saboat

texts.ru: Сабоат жительница Гиссарского района. Она замужем. Ей 44 года. У нее пятеро детей. Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации. Сама она имеет не большой участок земли, где занимается выращиванием овощей и посевом зерновых культур. В этой области она 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян картошки, пшеницы и закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Saboat is a resident of the Gissar district.  She is 44 years old, married and has five children.  Her husband is in the Russian Federation.  Saboat has a small plot of land, where she grows vegetables and plants cereal crops.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  Saboat is requesting this loan to buy potato and wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy potato and wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Барно более восьми лет занимается торговлей. Ей 43 года. Она открыла продуктовый магазин. Она разведена. У нее двое детей.  Барно берет кредит для покупки продуктов питания.
texts.en: Barno has been working in retail for over eight years. She is 43 years old. She keeps a grocery store. She is divorced and has two children. Barno is taking out a credit in order to purchase groceries.

loans.use: to purchase groceries [for resale].

loans.name: Marnie

texts.en: Marnie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marnie requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy snack foods and other groceries to sell. She has been in this business for two years. Marnie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy snack foods and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling kitchenware and ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more kitchenware to sell to customers. Mary Jane has been in this business for five years. Mary Jane earns more income from operating a general store.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more kitchenware to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 32-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has no children. He has two additional dependents. In 2005, Mohamed established his business selling drinks, water, and recharge cards. He began his business because of his low income. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about 700,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more inventory. In the future, Mohamed plans to bring in more essential products. He is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drinks, pure water and mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Muminjon

texts.ru: Муминджону 36 лет, он разводит дома овец и коз. Его жена помогает по уходу за скотом. Они также продают шерсть ангорских коз, их шерсть очень знаменитая в нашей области, из  вяжут теплую одежду. Они занимаются этим делом более 20 лет. Муминджон первый кредит получил у нас в 2010 году. Ему понравилось условия кредитования, с прошлого кредита он приобрел несколько голов коз и от проданной шерсти получил неплохой доход. Сейчас он также хочет купить скот для этого он получает у нас кредит. Муминджон благодарен КИВА за финансовую поддержку, и что может получить возможность улучшить своё будущее.
texts.en: Muminjon is 36 years old. He raises sheep and goats. His wife helps him take care of the livestock. They also sell mohair, which is very famous in their area and is used in knitting warm clothes. They have been engaged in this activity for over 20 years. Muminjon got his first loan in 2010. He liked the lending terms. With his first loan, Muminjon bought several head of goats and made a good profit from selling mohair. He would also like to buy livestock with another loan. That is why he requests a loan. Muminjon is grateful to KIVA for financial support and an opportunity to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy a few goats

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 23 года. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Она занимается торговлей. В этой области она два года. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов с целью увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Nargis lives in the city of Kulob. She is a divorced 23-year-old woman with two children. Nargis has been in sales business for two years.  She would like to get a loan to buy products in order to increase the turnover.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнаре 47 лет, замужем и имеет  троих детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, в 1999 году Гулнара начала свой бизнес в животноводстве с займа в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулнары, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется две дойные коровы и двенадцать овец, что позволяет ежемесячно получать примерно 15,000 сом с продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулнара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Гулнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Gulnara is 47 years old, married, and has three children. Seeking sources of income for her family, Gulnara started her own business of animal husbandry from a loan of 30,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulnara's dedicated work, her farm today counts two dairy cows and twelve sheep, which brings in around 15,000 som per month from the sale of dairy and meat products. In order to further develop her business, Gulnara turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional head of livestock. Gulnara is planning on investing the earnings from the loan in further increase of the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sayfuddin

texts.ru: Сайфуддину 54 года. Он занимается откормом коз. Он также работает в колхозе пастухом. У него в колхозе есть стадо, где  пасутся более 200 коз. Имея большой опыт в разведении скота, он также пасет сам коз на пастбище. Учитывая суровые условия, он отправляет свое стадо в горы, и зимой пригоняет обратно. Его жена не работает, но получает пенсию. Его сын находиться в Российской Федерации и присылает ему деньги. Но он не надеется на своего сына и сам имея свой бизнес, разводит коз и овец. Его младший сын помогает ему, он живет с ним и при покупке и  продаже скота помогает отвозить скот на рынок. Он благодарен КИВА за финансовую поддержку и надеется на дальнейшее сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Sayfuddin is 54 years old. He fattens goats and also works as a shepherd on a collective farm.  There is a herd on the collective farm, which counts over 200 goats.  Having rich experience in livestock raising, Sayfuddin also takes his goats to pasture.  Taking into consideration harsh weather conditions, Sayfuddin leads his herd into the mountains, and in winter he brings the animals back. Sayfuddin's wife does not work but has a pension. 
Sayfuddin's son is in Russia. He sends his father some money. Sayfuddin is not, however, totally dependent on his son in terms of money. He has his own goat and sheep raising business.  Sayfuddin's youngest son lives with him and helps Sayfuddin take the livestock to and from the market when animals get bought or sold. Sayfuddin is grateful to KIVA for financial support and is looking forward to further collaboration.

loans.use: to buy a few goats

loans.name: Humberto Mario

texts.es:
Humberto, vive con su familia, su esposa y tres hijos, él se dedica a atender la agricultura y ganadería, aprendió desde muy joven su padre le enseño, no tiene un horario fijo.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ganado que serian tres novillas, ya que tiene una buena oferta y aprovechando que al final puede venderlos y generar más ganancias.
Su aspiración es mantenerse en el negocio, ir creciendo, y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Humberto lives with his family, his wife and three sons.  He works tending to farming and livestock, which he learned when he was very young as his father taught him.  He does not have a fixed work schedule.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of cattle, namely three heifers, as he has been offered a good deal and taking advantage of it means that ultimately he can sell them and generate more earnings.

His goal is to keep his business going and to grow it, and to improve his family's living conditions.


, vive con su familia, su esposa y tres hijos, él se dedica a atender la agricultura y ganadería, aprendió desde muy joven su padre le enseño, no tiene un horario fijo.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ganado que serian tres novillas, ya que tiene una buena oferta y aprovechando que al final puede venderlos y generar más ganancias.
Su aspiración es mantenerse en el negocio, ir creciendo, y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: to purchase three heifers.

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es:
Rosa, está soltera, vive con sus padres, la vivienda es familiar, ella es la que sostiene al hogar, el negocio de Rosa es la venta de hot dog y pupusas, estos negocios los atiende durante la semana, de lunes a sábado, los hot dog desde las 9:00am hasta las 6:00pm y las pupusas los sábados de 4:00pm a 7:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus ventas como salchichas, aderezos, pan especial, aceite, quesillo, chicharrón, bebidas, entre otros productos que son de mucha necesidad para ella.
Este préstamo le dará mayor seguridad para atender el negocio, brindando un mejor servicio y prosperando con sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa is single and lives with her parents.  It’s a family household and she supports the home.  She sells hot dogs and pupusas during the week from Monday through Saturday; hot dogs from 9:00am to 6:00pm and pupusas from 4:00pm to 7:00pm on Saturdays.

She’s asking for this loan to buy ingredients such as sausages, dressings, special bread, cooking oil, cheese, fried pork rinds, and drinks among other things that she really needs.

This loan will provide her with a good opportunity to run her business, provide better service, and become more prosperous with her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: El socio Pedro Jose; continua con su pequeño negocio en casa el socio continua prestando el servicio de alimento el esta aun trabajando con su esposa en la atencion de sus pension familiar y para personas independientes. El socio en esta ocasion desea invertir el prestamo en la compra d einsumos y de productos al por mayor como arroz en bolsas, azucar, aceeite en bidones, sal en sacos, fideos en caja.
texts.en:
This member is Pedro Jose; he continues with is small business in his home, where he continues providing meals.  He is still working with his wife in tending to their boarding house for families and individuals.

On this occasion, the member wants to invest his loan in purchasing supplies and products at wholesale, such as bags of rice, sugar, drums of oil, bags of salt, and boxes of noodles.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and products at wholesale, such as bags of rice, sugar, drums of oil, bags of salt, and boxes of noodles.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Amanda  de 63 años es casada y tiene 4 hijos ya adultos que han formado su propia familia, es una mujer muy trabajadora que no le gusta depender de sus hijos ya que ella siempre ah trabajado para  apoyar a su esposo con los gastos. 

Amanda trabaja en una escuela que ofrece varios talleres; ella imparte clases de belleza y algunas ocasiones de manualidades, aparte tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada desde hace 4 años donde ofrece variedad de ropa para dama y caballero. En este momento pide el apoyo para compra ropa de temporada de frio y calor ya que se aproxima la nueva estación del año que es primavera por lo que quiere estar preparado con la ropa adecuada al clima.
texts.en:
Amanda, 63, is married and has four children who already are adults and have formed their own families.  She is a very hardworking woman who does not like to depend on her children because she always has worked to help her husband with the expenses.

Amanda works in a school that offers various workshops.  She gives classes on beauty and occasionally on handicrafts.  For four years she also has had a business selling used clothing where she offers a variety of clothing for women and men.

Right now she is requesting the loan to buy clothing for cold and hot weather because the new season is approaching, which is spring, and she wants to be prepared with clothing appropriate for the weather.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Reinaldo Ubaldo

texts.es:
Reinaldo es un hombre de 44 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comida rápida.

Su historia empezó con un amigo y luego decidí seguir solo porque me gusto cocinar y aquí estoy trabajando para salir adelante, su trabajo lo hace con un amigo todos los días de madrugada porque atiendo desde las 4 de la mañana, si tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no está casado, si tiene hijos estudia en escuela fiscal.

Su sueño más importante es quiero ponerme un local que sea seguro y crecer para darle mejoría a mi hija en su vida en adelante. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de comidA  y asi comprar carnes, vegetales, verduras, bebidas.
texts.en:
Reinaldo, 44, has high hopes for growing his food sales business over the next few years

He tells us that he worked with a friend before striking out on his own.  He likes to cook, he says, so opening a food sales business was a good option for him.  He normally starts work at 4 in the morning.  Yes, he has trouble with crime; No, he's not married; Yes, he has one child, now in school.

Reinaldo's greatest wish is to open a restaurant.  He wants to make a better life for his daughter.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy supplies for his food sales business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his food business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia desea invertir en su negocio de venta de quesos, en comprar por mayoreo ya que le están ofreciendo a muy buen precio, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar los quesos sin descapitalizar el ingreso de su negocio. 
Doña Alicia tiene ya mas de siete años dedicándose a la venta de quesos, tiene sus propios vendedores y en centros comerciales a quienes les vende. También quiere invertir en otros productos que son chorizo, carnes, especies, para tener más variedad de productos. 
Con las una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio pagara el crédito, ya que es la fuente de ingreso para solventar sus gastos,  sus hijos ya tiene su propia familia.
texts.en:
Señora Alicia wants to invest in her business selling cheese, by purchasing at wholesale as they are offering her a very good price.  However, she does not have the necessary money to make the investment.

She is requesting a loan to purchase the cheese without decapitalizing the income of her business.

Doña Alicia has been selling cheese for more than seven years.  She has her own resellers in the commercial centers, to whom she sells.  She also wants to invest in other products, namely chorizo sausage, meat, and condiments to be able to have a greater variety of products.

She will repay the loan with part of the earnings that she gets from her business, as this is her source of income for covering her expenses.  Her children already have their own families.

loans.use: to purchase cheese for selling.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: El socio  Abraham; continua con su negocio de comidas, el socio tambien tiene una pequeña pension familiar y el colabora a su esposa con la eatencion al publico en general, el socio desea poder invertir el prestamo en la compra de algunos viveres para el negocio el socio desea comprar arroz, aceite, entre otros productos para la elaboracion de los diferentes potajes y de este modo continuar apoyando en la educacion de sus hijos y tambien mantenerse activo. El socio requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, aceite, azucar, fideos entre otros.
texts.en: Our member, Abraham, operates a food sales business.  He and his wife also have a small "pension" [a kind of room rental business].  Abraham is applying for a loan that he will use to buy supples--cooking oil, rice, etc.--for his food sales business.  He makes and sells different kinds of stews.  The income from the business pays for his children's school fees and keeps him active.

loans.use: to stock his food sales business.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la sastrería, ella vive con sus cuatro hijos, su ocupación es la sastrería, confeccionando vestidos, trajes, pantalones, de este oficio ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas de variedad de colores y tipos, ya que es su principal materia que necesita para poder confeccionar sus prendas, este préstamo le ayudara para ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de colores en telas, de esta manera mantener la preferencia de los clientes.
La aspiración de María es invertir en su negocio, para hacerlo más productivo, esto le ayudara para mejorar la condición de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María works doing sewing.  She lives with her four children and her occupation is being a seamstress: she sews clothes, suits, trousers, and by these means she has been able to move her family ahead in life.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of various colors and types of fabric, as this is the principal material that she needs in order to to be able to sew her clothing.  This loan will help her to offer her customers a variety of colors of fabric, and in this way to meet her customers' preferences.

María's goal is to invest in her business to make it more productive.  This will help her to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy different colors and types of fabric.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar is 29 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and the three kids are kindergarten students. He started his carpentry business in 2007. He makes wooden tools, which are needed to build houses such as a housetop, door etc. His products are flawless and with modern design. Now he is well known for his work. His product demand is increasing. Therefore, he needs to renew his tools and equipment in order to work efficiently and fast. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I have to work hard in order to support my children". He is requesting 300,000 MNT to purchase new equipment.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is married with three children who are currently going to school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Monaliza is 33 years old.

Monaliza has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Monaliza requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her motorcycle transport business.

Monaliza has been in this business for four years. In the future, Monaliza would like to save enough money to buy additional multi-cabs for her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her motorcycle transport.business

loans.name: Madres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Madres Unidas
La Sra. Marleni tiene 32 años de edad,  es conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, Marleni  actualmente es socio en la alcancía comunal “Madres Unidas” grupo  conformado por  8 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.  Marleni trabaja en la preparación y venta al por mayor  de maní confitado y maní salado a su vez vende comida en las noches,  Marleni nos cuenta que su motivación para salir a delante es su familia y que trabajo muy duro para obtener lo que hoy en dia tiene,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación   se ha comprado una casa prefabricada , sus hijos van a  la escuela. Marleni  ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos mani azucar etc. Marleni cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
This is the "Madres Unidas" communal bank. Marleni is 32, lives in a common-law relationship, and has two school-age children. Marleni is currently a member of the “Madres Unidas” group, made up of eight members who have a variety of small businesses. 

Marleni makes and sells sugar-coated and salted peanuts at wholesale, and at the same time sells food in the evenings. Marleni tells us that the  motivation that keeps her going is her family, and that she worked very hard to get what she has today. Thanks to her effort and dedication she has bought herself a prefabricated house, and her children go to school. 

Marleni has applied for a new loan to buy ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, etc. Marleni will meet her goals through a lot of work and effort, and the Edaprospo loans will help her do this.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as peanuts and sugar.

loans.name: Luciana Victoria

texts.es:
Luciana es una joven de 26 años que disfruta mucho escuchar música, es fanática del “Arroz Chaufa”, ella ha estudiado hasta terminar el colegio completo y deseaba estudiar secretariado, pero debido a cuestiones familiares no pudo cumplir este sueño, tras esta etapa ella se prometió salir adelante y mejor su calidad de vida.

Para poder generar los ingresos que necesitaba, Luciana decidió vender ropa como recorredora, actualmente camina aproximadamente 5 horas bajo el intenso sol de la ciudad de Ica, en ese tiempo logra realizar la vente de varios productos, siempre está pendiente de poder incrementar la cantidad de sus clientes y desde luego ofrecerles un trato amable para que así reiteren sus compras.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Luciana podrá compra nueva ropa, en especial la que es para temporada escolar, debido a que en el mes de Marzo se inician las clases en los colegios en todo el Perú. Con esta ayuda desea poder duplicar la compra de sus clientes y también el número de los mismos, con los nuevos ingresos que obtenga desea poder comprar una casa propia y así acondicionar un espacio y colocar su boutique, su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Luciana is a young woman of 26 years old, who very much enjoys listening to music, and is a fan of Chinese fried rice.  She completed her secondary school education and wanted to study to be a secretary, but due to family issues she was not able to achieve this dream.  After this stage, she pledged to move ahead in life and improve her quality of life.

To be able to generate the earnings that she needed, Luciana decided to sell clothing as a street vendor.  She currently spends about five hours a day walking around under the intense sun in the city of Ica.  In this time, she is able to achieve the sale of various products.  She is always thinking about being able to increase the quantity of her customers, and for a long time has been offering them friendly service so that they will buy from her again.

With the help from the Kiva lenders, Luciana will be able to purchase new clothing, especially clothing for the back-to-school season as school classes start in the month of March throughout Peru.  With this assistance, she wants to double her customers' purchases, and also the number of customers.  With the new income that she will obtain, she wants to be able to purchase her own home and be able to set up a space there for a boutique, which is her big dream.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for the back-to-school season.

loans.name: Faamita

texts.en:
Faamita is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Saasaai.  She is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Faamita owns & operates a bakery.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking & selling a variety of confectionaries such as cookies and cakes in the local community.  Faamita has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 900 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Faamita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Faamita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  Faamita is now requesting a new loan of 2,000 WST to continue expanding the business.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Faamita from SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking supplies to expand her bakery

loans.name: Amilcar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Amilcar; el socio tiene  2 menores hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad; El socio trabaja haciendo fisioterapias y rehabilitaciones a personas que lo requieran, el socio tiene su propio centro de fisio terapias; el socio  es kinesiologo y fisioterapeuta de profesion.  El socio desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de un equipo para implementar su consultorio. 


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Amilcar belongs to the Huayna Piccu communal bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Amilcar has two minor children, ages 8 and 3.  He works doing physical therapies and rehabilitations for people who need it.  He has his own physical therapy center.  He is a kinesiologist and a physical therapist by profession.  He wants to use the loan to buy equipment to set up in his physical therapy center.

He is grateful to those who are part of this dream through the loan.  He pledges to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy equipment to set up in his physical therapy center.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 1 child. 

Ruben has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages.  He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan for 25,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Ruben has been a member of HSPFI for since 2002.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Tuuipo

texts.en:
Tuuipo is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of SalelavaluTai.  She is married and has 9 school-aged children.  To make a living, Tuuipo  owns & operates a fishing business, harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Tuuipo has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 800 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Tuuipo  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tuuipo  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2000 WST from SPBD.  She is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by this borrower from SPBD. Tuuipo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to continue improving her business.

loans.use: buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Soonalau

texts.en:
Soonalau is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Taga.  She is married and has 9 school-aged children.  To make a living, Soonalau owns & operates a fishing business, catching & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Soonalau has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Soonalau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Soonalau has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 WST from SPBD. Soonalau is now requesting a new loan of 1250 WST which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by this borrower from SPBD. Soonalau plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: buy fishing equipment and supplies

loans.name: Ferolini

texts.en:
Ferolini is a 26 -year-old woman who is married and has 3 children.  To make a living, Ferolini raises crops on a small plantation.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Ferolini has been engaged in this business for over 4 years.  From these activities, Ferolini earns approximately 800 WST a month.

In 2009, Ferolini joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ferolini is requesting a loan to purchase farm supplies and equipment to increase the yield of her land.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by this borrower from SPBD.  Ferolini plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to continue expanding her plantation.

loans.use: buy farm supplies and equipment to grow taro

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 31 years old.  She is married and has 3 children who are in school.   Josefina works very hard to provide for them.

Josefina runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, coffee, cream, sardines, snack foods, etc.  

Josefina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy more items to sell

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es: La socia continua con con el negocio de artesnaia, la socia  tambien renta su casa a estudiantes y personas en general, ella tien ahora un stand y a entrado de lleno en el negocio de artesania en especial de trabajos hechos en arcilla para decoracion en su mayoria. La socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de artesania para la venta.
texts.en: This member continues working in her handicrafts business.  She also lets out rooms in her home to students and the general public.  She now has a stand and has entered fully into the handicrafts business, mainly selling decorative pottery.  She would like to invest her loan in buying handicrafts to sell.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Gladys Obdulia

texts.es: La socia continua enseñando a niños, la soica a logrado poner su tienda de abarrotes, y ella en este tiempo que esta de vacaciones escolares estuvo terminando de modificar su negocio de tiend a de abarrotes. La socia desea implementar su tienda de abarrotes y comprar arroz, fideos, azucar, harinas, aceite, mazamorras, leche entre otros productos basicos y de consumo diario. La socia deaea invertir el prestamo en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en: This member continues teaching children.  She has also managed to set up her grocery store.  Over the school vacation period, she managed to finish making modifications to her grocery store business.  She would like to stock her store and buy rice, noodles, flour, oil, 'mazamorras' (milky, corn pudding), milk and other basic household products which people use every day.  She would like to invest her loan in buying basic household products.

loans.use: to buy basic household products

loans.name: Falefoe

texts.en:
Falefoe is a 29-year-old woman who is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To make a living, Falefoe owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Falefoe has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Falefoe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Falefoe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 720 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  Falefoe is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will be used to purchase more farm supplies & equipment.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by this borrower from SPBD.  Falefoe plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: buy farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Rodilyn

texts.en:
Rodilyn is 53 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Rodilyn earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from tailoring.

Rodilyn is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 38-year-old married woman with 5 children.  The oldest child is 19 years old.  Myrna's husband works a as a farmer.

Myrna used to sell gasoline but decided to work with her husband and focus on farming.  She helps till their land and plant rice crops. Myrna also helps sell their harvest at their town's market. Mryna works hard to build their business. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and other farm inputs. Myrna hopes for this loan to help increase their harvest.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family.  She is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 7 years now, and also earns additional income from hog raising.

Julieta requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fishing gear

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Teresita has a shop that sells vegetables like cabbages, carrots & potatoes. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in the Philippines. Jocelyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

Jocelyn is requesting a loan for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell..

loans.name: Fanny Betty

texts.es:
La mujer que ustedes pueden apreciar en la fotografía es Fanny, una mujer de 29 años, que tiene una pequeña de 5 años, a la cual ama y se desvive por estar pendiente de ella y darle toda la protección y cuidados que necesita. Por algunas razones personales Fanny se separó de su esposo y es por ello que decidió salir adelante sola con su hija.

Para poder solventar todos sus gastos, se dedica a la venta de calzados por catálogo desde hace 2 años, tiempo en el que ha aprendido sobre el manejo de este tipo de negocio, en la actualidad ella labora un promedio de 8 horas diarias, tiempo en el que atiende entre 2 y 5 clientes. Para asegurarse de que sus clientes volverán a realizarle compras ella les brinda facilidades de pago como también la garantía necesaria de los productos vendidos, pero básicamente se desvela por brindar una buena atención.

Con la ayuda de este préstamo, ella podrá realizar la compra anticipada de varios zapatos para su venta y así disminuirá en el tiempo en la atención de los pedidos, cuando sus ganancias empiecen a mejorar realizará la compra de un exhibidor y logrando incrementar sus ventas logrará juntar el dinero suficiente para tener una casa propia para ella y su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Fanny is the woman in the photo.  She is 29 years old and has a 5 year old little one.  She loves her daughter very much, and she does her utmost to be vigilant and provide her with all of the necessary care.  For personal reasons Fanny separated from her husband.  Therefore, she decided to get ahead with only herself and her daughter.

In order to be able to pay for all of her expenses she has been selling footwear by catalog for two years.  During this time she has learned how to manage this type of business.  She currently works an average of eight hours a day.  During that time she tends to between two and five customers.

To make sure that her customers return to shop with her Fanny offers them easy payment arrangements.  She also provides the necessary guarantee of the products sold.  Basically she goes out of her way to provide good service.

With the help of this loan she will be able to buy, in advance, various shoes to sell.  This will cut down on the time the orders take to fill.  When her income starts to improve she will buy a showcase.  When she manages to increase her sales she will get enough money together to have her own house for herself and her young daughter.

loans.use: to buy footwear.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer and she works with her husband on their farm. She helps plant rice crops and sell their harvest. She also sells fish in her neighborhood.

Presentacion is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. She joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services.  Presentacion works hard to support her family. She hopes to have her own capital in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en:
Lucel is 30 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines.  Lucel has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

Lucel is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future,Lucel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and  beverages to sell.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 40 years old, married, and has one child.  He lives in the Philippines.  Eduardo provides motorela or motorcycle services, which he has been doing for five years. 

Eduardo is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which he will use to buy tools and pay for gasoline.  He has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Eduardo hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to purchase tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has had this business for eight years.

Nimfa is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy materials for fishing boat maintenance.  In the future, Nimfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for fishing boat maintenance.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 52 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in the Philippines.  Conchita makes and sells snacks such as boiled corn and binaki (a native delicacy in Mindanao which is mainly made from corn).  She has had this business for 10 years. 

Conchita is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.   In the future, Conchita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is a hard-working farmer who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family. He has been tilling his land for more than 10 years. Vicente primarily grows rice crops to sell. He earns about 5,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Vicente hopes to earn better and be able to send all his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Flor De Jocote Group

texts.en:
The trust bank “Flor de Jocote” (Jocote is a fruit, which grows widely in the area) was formed in 2010 in a tiny rural village called Cruz Blanca, San Juan Sacatepequez, in the central highlands of Guatemala, where access is by dirt road. The group is very active and dynamic; it is composed of seven women, dedicated to various commercial and production activities, such as: sale of clothing, animal husbandry, and the sale of meat, which are sold in the community or the nearest market (20 minutes away from the village). All the members are neighbors and know one another.  This is their third loan cycle, and their two previous loans with Friendship Bridge were paid in full and on time. 

Maria Francisca, treasurer of the group, is forty-six years old, married and has four daughters. In recent years Maria Francisca has been a working with livestock, rather than weaving. She sells her products in the market nearby (20 minutes from where she lives) on Mondays, Wednesdays and Saturdays. Maria Francisca believes strongly in good education, although she did not have the opportunity to attend school herself, but she encourages her daughters, currently in kindergarten, 1st, 4th and 5th grades, to stay in school.  Her dream is that they graduate from high school and ultimately from college. 

With the new loan, Maria Francisca wants to increase her sales. She plans to add variety to her business, so she will buy more chickens, turkeys, ducks and pigs to meet her clients’ needs. With her income Maria Francisca can provide better standard of living for her family, as the cost of living has increased and her husband's income is not enough. Maria Francisca is very optimistic about the future; she hopes to be more successful through growing her business with the support of her daughters. 

Maria Francisca and her Trust Bank are very grateful that people from around the world know about them and take time to invest in them. They believe that Friendship Bridge and Kiva loans make a difference in their lives. "Wow, technology has advanced, and there are no barriers to support another human being," says Francisca Maria Larios.

loans.use: To buy more chickens, turkeys, ducks and pigs.

loans.name: Flor San Juanera Group

texts.en:
Flor San Juanera, "Saint John Flowers" Trust bank is located in San Juan Sacatepequez, a small town outside Guatemala City in the central highlands of Guatemala where a large percentage of the country’s of flowers are grown. The members have a variety of businesses, including: selling cosmetics, selling flowers, selling fruit, embroidery and selling clothes. Having formed in 2010, the ladies are an active and dynamic group; they know each other well; and they share a close friendship. This is their fourth loan cycle, and they paid their three previous loans in full and on time. 

Also in her fourth cycle, Rosa Maria is thirty-six years old, has four children (two boys and two girls) who are in 1st, 2nd, 6th and 7th grades.  Rosa Maria is the president of her trust bank, and her business is embroidery, a practice she learned from her husband thirteen years ago. Dedicated to her practice, she is perfecting the technique. Rosa Maria also sells traditional clothing. As she lives near the market, she made a small space in a room in her house to open a small shop where she sells her products. Rosa Maria is excited to get another loan with Friendship Bridge, which she will use to purchase fabric and thread to fill the orders she has, especially during this time of the year (which is right before Easter).  Many people place orders with her because of her modern designs. Rosa Maria's dream is to have market stall or storefront in the market. Although she has a small space in her house, she wants to be closer to new clients and display her products in the market, that way she would be able to sell more product and generate more income to support her family. 

On behalf of her Trust Bank partners, Rosa Maria, says, “I am very happy that people from other countries who have more possibilities, have the desire to help those who intend to move forward with small businesses. I thank Kiva investors for opening the doors of opportunity for the benefit of our families and community."

loans.use: To purchase fabric and thread to fill the orders she has.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child.

Virginia has a shop that sells fish like trout, mackerel and sardines. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of fish to sell.

Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2006.  In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell

loans.name: Apajok

texts.en:
Apajok lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old and married. She has three children and two of them are still in school. 

Apajok heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 

Reynaldo has a shop that sells coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) and green bananas per kilogram. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of coconuts and bananas to sell.

Reynaldo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Reynaldo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of coconuts and bananas to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling plastic wares. Evelyn is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her business of buying and selling vegetables.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Agau

texts.en:
Agau is 39 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom attend school.  She lives in Bor and sells fish, which she has been doing for three years. 

Agau is requesting her second loan for 800 SDG, which she will use to purchase fish.  She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell..

loans.name: Seyde

texts.ru: Сейде 62 года, имеет  троих детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, в 1996 году Сейде начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Сейде, на сегодня в  ее хозяйстве имеется две коровы, семь голов овец, одна лошадь, что приносит примерно 12,000 сом с продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  Также, Сейде возделывает 2,28 га земли с зерновыми культурами, картофелем и эспарцетом. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сейде обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Сейде планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья домашней скотины.
texts.en: Seyde is 62 years old and has three children.  In search of a financing source for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 1996 with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Seyde's persistent work, today her business has two cows, seven heads of sheep and one horse, and yields about 12,000 som from sales of milk and meat products.  Also, Seyde works on 2.28 hectares of land, where she grows cereal crops, potatoes and sainfoin.  In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  Seyde plans to invest the earnings into increasing the headcount of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Nyanthie

texts.en:
Nyanthie lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for two years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school. 

Nyanthie heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor works hard to support her family. She is married and has a jewelry business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more jewelry to sell to customers.

Eleonor has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Eleonor would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to sell to customers.

loans.name: Margelita

texts.en:
Margelita is 45 years old, married and has six children. With all her children in school, Margelita works very hard to provide for them.

Margelita runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Margelita has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Margelita would like to save enough money to expand her general store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a 28-year-old married woman with two children aged 6 and 1. Her husband works as a farmer.

Aileen is a seaweed farmer. With her income, she is able to help provide for her family's basic needs. Aileen is working hard to improve her small business and save for her children's education. She has requested a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, string and other materials. Aileen hopes for her family to experience a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, string and other materials

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 60 years old. She has 12 children aged between 16 and 38 years. All of them attend school but the three oldest attend colleges while the rest attend their high schools. Immaculee wants this loan to buy more items to sell in the her store such as sugar, salt, and soap. She hopes to use the profits for paying school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Ajah

texts.en:
Ajah lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children - two of them are still in school. 

Ajah heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Azymkul

texts.ru: Азымкул 60 лет, вдова, имеет  двоих взрослых детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, в 2006 году Азымкул начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Азымкул, на сегодня в  ее хозяйстве имеется три коровы, десять голов овец, два бычка, что   приносит в квартал примерно 30,000 сом с продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Азымкул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Азымкул планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья домашней скотины.
texts.en: Azymkul is 60 years old, a widow and has two adult children. In search of a financing source for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 2005 with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Azymkul's persistent work, today her business has three cows, ten heads of sheep and two bulls, and yields about 30,000 som quarterly from sales of milk and meat products.  In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock. Azymkul plans to invest the earnings into increasing the headcount of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Selaphine

texts.en:
Selaphine is 39 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have 6 children who all are enrolled in school. 

With the loan, Selaphine is planning to add more foodstuffs such as bananas and potatoes to sell, since she has been running the same business for the past 4 years. She wants to pay school fees for the children from the profits that will be obtained from the business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as bananas and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina works hard to support her family. Carolina is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Carolina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Carolina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 38 years old and married with two children.

Alberta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, groceries etc. to sell in her general store.

Alberta has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from her internet cafe.

Alberta aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack food, groceries etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 40 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Analiza works very hard to provide for them.

Analiza runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Analiza has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and groceries. 

In the future Analiza would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy items like groceries to sell her sari-sari (variety) store.
